honestly after 3 weeks of using it every day, I don’t know what value they are charging for. Record my mood and some quotes throughout th day?? Thats it???

Oh and asking me to purchase a bundle upgrade every time I log in.. i just purchased an app the should be free for what it does, why would I give this ANY more money?

Author: callmecelery
Subject: Can’t unsubscribe from premium!
Body:
I liked this app, but this is unacceptable. 

I’ve tried a lot of mental health apps over the last year, and Reflectly was among them. It was helpful, and I liked what the premium features offered, so I subscribed when they offered a discount. (Let’s face it, $60/year is a lot when you’re still testing the waters.) Recently I’ve found other apps that work better for me, so I decided to unsubscribe from their premium service, but I found myself unable to do so. 

There is no option in the app itself, or in Apple subscription settings, ANYWHERE. The only thing you *can* do is change to a different subscription price. 

I tried deleting my account, deleting the app... Still nothing. This is absolutely unacceptable.

I hope they fix it, and when they do I’ll change my review, because I honestly did like the app. But until then I am incredibly disappointed in this developer.

Author: Laurel1983
Subject: Thumbs up
Body:
I find the app’s general feel to be casual, friendly, and non-demanding. Usually I hate mood tracking apps, so for that fact alone it was worth it to me to pay for a year’s subscription (once I’d been using it to journal for a few days, and it was on offer for a significant discount.) I’m hoping to not need the tracking option so much in a year’s time.

Usually I’d find the fact that you have to complete a “mood check-in” to make a new journal entry off-putting, but I’m finding the tracking so useful that it’s totally worth it to put the effort in and take the ten seconds to complete. You can add your own one-word answers to the three multiple-choice check-in questions (with little pictures that you choose to make them easy to scroll through and find), and then look back on trends and see not only how your emotions have changed but what you were doing during those times.

Author: Rebecca MJ
Subject: Almost perfect
Body:
So far I will say this is the best daily reflection app I’ve seen in a while since using daylio a couple years back, but there are a few things that could use improvement. 

I wish you could go back and upload your old pictures and do the challenges if you forget to do it that day but it simply won’t let you, you can only add on your Reflectly entry from previous days. And I think they do that so you can remember to do it every day and be consistent, so if you miss a day, you miss out of the fun aspects of this app such as uploading a photo or doing the wisdom / challenge of the day (which I understand cause this app is trying to make you more consistent - but at least let us re-upload photos since we’re allowed to re-enter past Reflectly entries). 

Other than that annoying thing, the app is beautiful and very user friendly, and I hope the developers can fix the photo upload entry thing soon cause I’d definitely be willing to give an updated review. Good luck and happy reflecting!

Author: PrplGrl3
Subject: Worst app ever
Body:
I was enjoying using this app, because I have really not been going through a good time, still aren't, because of being severely ghosted and neglected by my bf, and writing down what I was going through in journal entries and receiving quotes that helped build me up was helpful. 
Then, one day, after I made a journal entry about him going so far as neglecting me on christmas day, like not even taking the time to reply or answer a christmas wish I sent him, Reflectly goes and sends me a quote saying something like, 'you have to be mindful about what you say to people.'

....................................

REALLY?! I'm the one being neglected here, but I'm now considered inconsiderate of people by writing down how avoiding me and making me feel devalued by my bf is hurting me???

BOOM, app gone. I'm sorry, but never have I seen such a poor choice of quote chosen for me at such a time. I'm not the one being inconsiderate here, because I have reached out multiple times to my bf to try to be understanding, told him I could give him space if he wanted it, but he never replies anymore, or takes the whole day to get around to it, so stuff you, REFLECTLY, how dare you send me a quote of being mindful of others when I have done EXACTLY THAT, I have been doing that for so long now, it's time to stop putting people first, and stand up for myself. It's wrong to expect me to keep being the first one to reach out when someone is continuing to disregard my feelings and ignore me every day, making me feel crappy every day. You're supposed to be at least one of your partner's priorities in a relationship, but I know I'm not anymore, to him :/ Telling me to be more 'mindful of other people' when I am the one beingbmistreated here, is like saying to be mindful of a narcassist, and completely ignore my own feelings.....

Author: bananya cat
Subject: Great!
Body: I have had this app for only a few days, but I love it! I love how it has unlimited check-ins and motivational messages! It sends you notifications like, “I’m always here if you need to talk!” And you never know how much you need to hear that until you do. I also enjoy how you can create your own moods to add to what you’re feeling. My only complaint is that every single time you go into the app, it immediately gives you the ad for premium. It’s easy to click out of, but it’s the first thing I see when I open the app. Overall an amazing app, I totally recommend!

Author: Jazleyn L.
Subject: Jazleyn L.
Body: This app is amazing for people going through a rough time or for just anyone who wants to talk about their day. It is an awesome platform to vent on and get your thoughts out whiteout anyone seeing them. You can always look back and see what you were going through on previous days and how you felt. When my friend first recommended the app for me, I thought that it was silly and it had no point. But my opinions changed when I got it. It’s nice to get things off your chest, even if no one else sees what you wrote but you. And I love how at the end of everyday, Reflectly sends me a notification saying how I deserve trophies and that if today was a bad day, that tomorrow would be better and that it they’re glad I got through the day. So I’ll do it back because this app is slowly but surely, changing my life in a good way. 10/10 app, thank you!!! 🏆🏆🏆

Kind of sad too cause I did enjoy it when I was able to properly access it.

Author: advirvf
Subject: subscription across devices and no response
Body:
I’ve paid for a subscription, which I have been for months now, but I have yet to access said subscription across devices. I can only access the premium functions on my phone, though the entries / reflections sync across said devices. And as someone with a lot of thoughts, I sometimes like writing it on my iPad where I have a keyboard and can type faster. But it’s extremely annoying when you’re paying for something but I’m not able to access the thing I’m paying for.

I’ve also tried contacting support but I never received a response, nor did I get a response to the review I left a couple weeks after that.

Only reason I’m giving two stars instead of one is because I genuinely like the app and its functions, but the whole point of it disappears when I can’t always access them when I’m paying for it. And not being able to get a response either through either support or the last review I made makes me question the seriousness of the developer.

Good way to lose loyal and long-time subscribers.

Author: Lyonsishere
Subject: Diaries of a Schizo
Body:
I have schizophrenia and this app allows me to unload an unlimited amount of toxic thoughts without hurting anyone. 

It sometimes genuinely feels like someone is listening intently. I recommend the large quote widget. The quotes aren’t always nice in manner, but they seem to be AI tailored. 

I’ve gotten upset from a few quotes, but I always had take aways that equaled what I felt. 

I get pretty graphs that summarize my emotions too. It’s allowed me to dial in to what really matters the most to me. 

The money to subscribe can be an issue and it takes work to find the value.

Author: RC-DC
Subject: Good App but no support
Body:
I was using the free app for few months and it was doing well.  However every time you launch it, it asked for you to buy additional features.  I purchased the $10 version to stop getting all the pop ups and notifications about purchasing.   That made it even better.  

Now I am very disappointed in the app.  When I received the renewal alert I did not pay too much attention, as a $10 value was worth it for I use.   However the renewal is for $99.99.  I thought that was a bit tricky.  I notified the customer support feature, the only contact available, and have not received any contact.  I have cancelled my subscription, but I am losing faith in any sort of refund.   

Good app, but beware of the renewal.

Author: Melteaser
Subject: Easy to use & nice design
Body:
Reflectly is surprisingly a pretty decent app. Especially for, if like myself, you are a bit of a novice when it comes to journaling! I have never been much of a person to discuss or even explore my feelings but have, for some years, been on the look out for a "thoughts & feelings" diary style app. 

I have been using Reflectly for about 3-4 days now. I actually find it useful to sit for a moment and actually think about and record how I am feeling at that exact moment. What's good about the app is it allows you to select quick tags as for why you are feeling how you do. By asking for mood updates throughout the day I am able to better understand my own mood patterns rather than just reflecting on the day as a whole. 
I like the option to be able to go more in depth with each mood update if I should want to. 

I do like the daily challenges however the app could be improved by making it not necessary to post a picture so to be able to complete these. Also the app should allow you to make notes about either completing or not completing the daily challenges. 

I also like the daily "thought of the day" insights that I see in the app and also on my home and lock screens (iOS 16 update). However you are only able to select one metric for these and are unable to select multiple "types/genres" of thought provoking words of wisdom. 

In summary; I do like how I can track when and why I am feeling how I feel. I like that I can add in my own tags to this as it makes it personal to me. 

To improve: 
- allowance to select more than one filter for thought of the day insights
- do not require a photo only to complete daily challenges but add in option for text as alternative or in addition too. 
- it would be nice to be able to track location when completing a mood update too.

Author: Don't give into this app!
Subject: Expensive
Body: I love the app, but there is one thing that bothers me. There is a subscription that you must have in order to do many things, i understand having a subscription in order to use the app for things like games, but on a mental health app? it is just sickening, using others mental state in order to boost the apps ego? it’s a no for me.

Author: Windblüte

Man kann auch ohne die Premium Version zu kaufen wirklich Spaß haben, die täglichen kleinen Challenges helfen deine Einstellung zu verbessen, die Grafik ist wirklich süß und einfach gestalten.
Jeden Tag einen kleinen Eintrag zu schreiben ist ebenfalls leicht und man kann sich selber besser kennenlernen!
Keine ADS :3
Nur eine klare Empfehlung von mir ^^
Translated Body:
You can really have fun without buying the premium version, daily little challenges will help improve your attitude, graphics are really cute and easy to design.
Writing a small entry every day is also easy and you can get to know yourself better!
No ADDS :3
Just a clear recommendation from me ^^

Author: Potato-Pot ah to
Subject: Such a calming and useful app !
Body: Im not exactly known to make reviews on these types of apps , or any type of app for that matter . . . But I felt the need to express my appreciation for this downloadable app . If your on the fence about downloading this app for yourself or someone you know , then allow me to ease your mind. Life can get pretty stressful so its nice to know at the end of the day you can come home and jot down all your feelings into Reflectly . Its hard to come up with complaints about anything in this app to be completely honest. In conclusion , I hope this review helped whoever may be reading this and I hope you all have an amazing day . :)

Author: _time_to_fall_
Subject: Pretty Good App
Body: It’s a pretty good app, as my title says. I use it to journal about my feelings in a way that makes me feel better. I think that everyone should have this. The only reason I’m not rating it five stars is because the really push their “self care bundle” in your face, every *single* time you open the app. I’m not here to buy the bundle, Reflectly, I’m just here to talk about my feelings in a way that will make me feel better. Other than that small issue, though, the app is great and I would highly recommend it to anyone. It’s very positive, and makes me feel overall happier after I journal here.

Author: agavrilova
Subject: Charged me money and disappeared
Body:
Upd: it took a while, but they were able to resolve the issue and were nice about it. Updating to 3 stars because of the slow response time from the support team. But I have no hard feelings with this app 🤍

tldr; They charged me $80 cad not through the Apple and went no contact. Absolutely non-existent customer service. I used reflectly for a week or so last year, then I deleted the app and forgot about it until 2 weeks ago, when a charge by reflectly for $80 appeared on my credit card. It was not an Apple subscription, it was billed directly by reflectly. I reinstalled the app just in case I forgot to cancel something - nope, no premium, nothing. Also no receipt anywhere. What’s more astounding is that they refuse to help. I reached out to their tech support, they said they will look into it and stopped responding to me for a week now. I had to file a fraud complaint with my credit card company, since reflectly is not responding. You’d think taking peoples money without their consent or without providing them with services for that money would be a bigger issue for them, alas I have no faith that they care.

Author: Zoe_iPhone10
Subject: Mostly annoying, but functions well
Body:
I’ve had this app for over a year and a half. During this period, every single time I have opened the app it has offered me a discount on premium.
Do I care? Not really, but most features are pay to use. So it’s pretty much a standard diary app with a face id/finger print passcode.

I’m pretty sure you have to pay for colours (regarding theme) and to see how you mood averages out.

Overall, its kind of pathetic as to how much it wants you to buy stuff but other than that its fine.

Body: I’m not one to ever write a review, let alone a bad review, but I just had such a horrible experience with the customer support with this app. I messaged the contact and “hello” email more than 6 times and have been met with radio silence. I got one email from a girl named “Nicole” and no assistance afterwards even after I followed up 5 times. Her email to me was generic and copy pasted, it did not address my issue at all. I will be disputing the charge on my card because this has just been ridiculous.

Author: agavrilova
Subject: Charged me money and disappeared
Body:
I used reflectly for a week or so last year, then I deleted the app and forgot about it until 2 weeks ago, when a charge by reflectly for $80 appeared on my credit card. It was not an Apple subscription, it was billed directly by reflectly. I reinstalled the app just in case I forgot to cancel something - nope, no premium, nothing. Also no receipt anywhere.
What’s more astounding is that they refuse to help. I reached out to their tech support, they said they will look into it and stopped responding to me for a week now.
I had to file a fraud complaint with my credit card company, since reflectly is not responding. You’d think taking peoples money without their consent or without providing them with services for that money would be a bigger issue for them, alas I have no faith that they care.

Author: Tia Hallis
Subject: I LOVE this reflection journal!
Body: I struggle with short term memory loss, dyslexic and adhd. This app has not only helped me remember what has happened durning the day, but it seems to be something I click constantly to keep myself updated on how I’m feeling. I have always loved planners and decorating them with colourful pens and stickers but I will stop after about 4 days of owning it. LOL. So the simplicity of having everything ready to go all you have to do is click some buttons and you’re done! Its something that is really matching up with my life style. I’m feeling relief being able to remember my feelings and events that happened during the day! Thrilled I came across this app! ❤️

Author: please no hate
Subject: i’m in love… ❤️
Body:
so i have some trouble with my feelings, and i used to have a journal for everything that happened every day in my life. and i lost it! and i thought that i would never lose my phone so, i said maybe i should download a app to keep track of my day? so i looked up some things and i found this! i have had this app for about 1 month now and i have had no problems with it! some people think otherwise. but this is probably the best choice i ever made to download this app. it makes it so easy. so i thought it’s finally time to write a review, and i’m just going to let everybody know that this app is free! and i’m am using it on the free version, and it is still awesome. so if you are thinking about getting this app, DO IT! 

-the apps biggest fan 💗

Author: hdisjebejdigbwhb
Subject: Absolutely Perfect
Body: Reflectly is such an easy to use and effective app that can help, and has helped many people who struggle with mental health. it has personally helped me with my mental and physical health in a short amount of time. it helps me get my mind off of things that are stressing me out or making me anxious. it also helps me reflect on the situations that are making me feel that way, and helps me reflect on many more things that are issues in my life. It can also be a useful tool to people who just want to get into journaling to better themselves or just for fun. i recommend this app to anybody whether you are struggling with mental health or just want to get into journaling.

Author: Soph 😍💅🏼
Subject: Extremely helpful!
Body: Hey, I usually don’t like journaling or writing down how I feel or anything, but I decided to give Reflectly a try and it’s helped a lot! I’m not able to get the premium but the free version has plenty of features that I wouldn’t expect from an app with a premium feature. I also like how the app automatically saves your notes so you can look back on them. I also really appreciate the quotes, it can be very nice to just sit on the couch and scroll through quotes that can inspire you. One thing I’d like to note is that if you click your stats, it will say you have to complete a certain amount of reflections to unlock it because the app doesn’t have enough information about your progress, but once you complete those reflections it will say it’s only available with premium. Although, in the background you can still see stats that are slightly faded out. I’m not sure if that’s just an example to show you the layout or if your progress is there but just faded. Anyway, this is getting long but the gist is that if you are thinking about getting this app to help with your mental health, I 100% recommend it! If you read this whole thing, have a wonderful day/night!

Author: trishiatrish
Subject: I LOVE THIS
Body: I've been using this app since April 2020, two years now. And I've seen myself grow and learn. Seen how my life has changed in good and bad ways. I've never liked journaling with a pen and A book. So this was a very good way to avoid that but get the same outcome. I really recommend you getting this application because it helps you see how much you have matured it's also really nice to go back and read some of your most important memories. This app has in-app purchases, I've not once payed for this app, I don't have the premium or anything. You don't have to pay to have a good experience on this app. So I rate it a 5/5 stars. ❤️❤️

Author: NekoEsmahh
Subject: Gratefulness to recall upon
Body:
Love the app, but it’s definitely missing that gratitude aspect to be able to go back on on the “entries” and/or weekly/monthly breakdown. 

Maybe allow us to make a list of things we are grateful for and different guided questions where we can go into more depth about. 

Finch has a “think deeper” feature that I really think you guys should get inspiration from. It would definitely improve the app so much more!

Author: peterpan098
Subject: Amazing Wellbeing App!
Body:
Reflectly is an amazing app that helps you keep track of your emotion, hobbies and day-to-day life. You can quickly add a mood check-in or voice note that takes less than two minutes, or use the unique reflection prompts for each day. Inspirational quotes are a great addition.
The app’s general appearance is super aesthetic and calm, with a little friendly face that guides you through check-ins and reflections! You can choose a colour scheme and the whole app adjusts to match, with aesthetic widgets and backgrounds to match. Like all apps with in-app purchases, there are consistent messages asking you to upgrade the app but overall Reflectly is a beautiful app!

Author: advirvf
Subject: Double subscription?
Body:
I’ve been using this app for a while now, and I love it. I love the daily challenge, and the different reflections you get every day.

However, one thing that irks me, that I’ve also tried to contact support about, is that I am subscribed to Reflectly Premium, but whenever I try to use it on my iPad, the subscription doesn’t show. I can’t find any button saying “restore purchases” either, so I can only use it on my phone, even though I am a paying customer. It seems wrong to me to have to pay double in order to use it on both of my devices.

Author: ReneeNZ99
Subject: Great concept but not accessible
Body: I really love this concept of a friendly AI to keep track of mental health. However, the app is difficult to access while completely blind, as I am. Author: MGrabs93
Subject: Great, until you want to see progress
Body:
One of the reasons I got the app was because of the slider bar for your mood, compared to the typical 5 choices between horrible, bad, ok, etc.
However, if you wanna see something basic with how your moods have been or look back at where you’ve come from, you have to pay for premium to unlock any kind of status update or chart. Lots of other apps have the weekly/monthly status things for free, but you need to “unlock with premium” to use it on this app.
And of course, you’re not allowed to even have access until you’ve entered ‘check-ins’ for 5 days.

I liked it for a bit, but I’ll probably look for another app now.

Author: Luke Maxin
Subject: If you don’t pay it’s worthless
Body:
It’s basically pointless as a free app with no stats to follow and you’re constantly bombarded with payment plans. 

I’m not paying a subscription model for something like this it’s not Netflix you’re not bringing out new content every month, it’s just a well put together glorified journal, give me a one time cost and I would’ve definitely considered it but the idea of paying a yearly subscription is ridiculous.

It also does a shady thing where on the first day you download the app it will offer you a discount, if you ignore this it well then subsequently offer you a much larger discount in the following days, so if you do intend to pay wait a couple of days first otherwise they’ll just squeeze more money out of you

Subject: It’s amazing! My only issue is

My only issue is that I can’t blacklist certain topics from coming up. Some topics that come up in the mindfulness, quotes, and check-ins can be triggering and I wish there was a way to keep them from coming up. I wish there was a way to blacklist certain topics from coming up, such as health, so I can use the app more productively.

Subject: really good.
Body: I’m not a very happy person. To be honest I don’t think I’ve ever been the happiest ever. So I decided to give a therapy type of app a go. None of them were working but i downloading this one and it really does help me. It checks every day how I’m doing and asks me to give reasons why I’m good/bad and how it’s making me feeling. It then lets you put photos of your day on your diary and it also gives you motivational quotes that actually work. To add to that, everyday it gives you a challenge to do, e.g go for a walk. AND. They do a different sentence every day that they ask you to fill. E.g “favouriteFriday” “my favourite colour is _______ because ________” it really is such a good app.

Subject: AMAZING!
Body: I downloaded Reflectly after seeing someone mention it on Pinterest. But- LET ME TELL YOU- I’ve never used an app that I was so obsessed with. It helps bring a good, positive mind set. It also has so many amazing quotes that you can organize, share, and like (that makes me feel mentally better). It gives you simple and healthy daily challenges like lighting a candle or practicing yoga that I have so much fun with. On top of that it has daily reflections and mood trackers to write about your day or explain something you’ve been struggling with. I have never willingly gave an app a good rating until I downloaded Reflectly. I definitely recommend it and hope you try it out! 😊

But I feel like you shouldn’t have to pay to do things. Now you can totally disagree aboit this but it’s my opinion and I respect yours. Teenagers have a lot going on in there life even some adults and we need to understand to not pay to get the attention we need and we should just have this app to feel comfortable and express our true feelings. But other than that I love the quotes, I love how you rate able to do a voice message, and I love the little card notes.hands down to whom ever made this app. Trophy for you 🏆

Author: Bey Kemmly
Subject: Solid app
Body:
I’ve used the Reflectly for a couple years at this point and I enjoy it. The journaling is simple as the bare minimum all one must do it give their mood. The app tracks the user’s mood this way and the causes of the user’s mood. The app collects this data and can be used to help understand what things in the user’s life are causing certain moods. The app also has daily quotes that are related to the user’s journal entries to help the user feel better or motivate them. The app has helped me either be more mindful when I’ve been in a bad headspace or to appreciate life more when I’ve been in a good headspace. Watching the graph of your mood steadily go up and stay up is oddly gratifying. The description of the 
app in the app store mentions cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT). CBT is based on an idea that psychological problems are based in part on ways of thinking and behavior. Finding better ways to cope with negative thoughts or behaviors by recognizing one’s own faulty thinking and bad behaviors and working to fix them as well as facing fears and calming the mind and body are ways that CBT helps. The app is reminiscent of this with its reflective journaling and mindful quotes, and if it is committed to a nice routine can be developed. I would not call the app actual CBT though as there is no therapist to guide the user. The app can be helpful I believe as a way of tracking mood and emotions, as well as being reminded to practice mindfulness but at the end of the day is a journaling app more so than a CBT app and should not be used as a replacement for seeing a licensed therapist.

Subject: A few suggestions for an already great app

I love this app, first of all. I love the daily reflections and the quotes and all of that, but I do have a few suggestions.

- A way to sort by photos. So a way to see all your photos at once, kind of like in the photos app

Body:
This app is amazing. It has very inspirational quotes and beautiful themes. Also, most apps like this make you pay for premium and that’s the only option but this one is really good because you don’t need premium or need to spend ANY money on it. The daily challenges are fun and motivational too. Just a few suggestions :)
1. Maybe do 1 or two daily challenges if some people are bored or you could add in other things like a stress relieving mini game or something. 
2. Pls pls pls add more activities. When it says what made your day good/bad there are only a few and I think it would be awesome if you could like make your own or at least have some more. 
Other than that, this app has been so good and the best journaling app I have ever downloaded. Tysm! ✨🙏

Author: KG3324
Subject: Great app, but could use some (very) minor improvements to be 5 star
Body: I have been using this app daily for 1 week and so far have really loved the experience. The developers did a great job designing a peaceful, enjoyable experience. However, I have some recommendations that could really bring this app to be the absolute best. First, being able to move and organize the placement of the activity and emotion on the check in page. It would make the experience more seamless to be able to group the emotions together (ie all the positive emotions on one side). Another recommendation is being able to filter your entries to better reflect. For example, if you filter by the activity “exercise” you can see all the entries that you included that activity, and correlate how you were feeling/ what you were doing that day with that activity. Same goes for emotion, it would be nice to filter entries by a chosen emotion to better reflect and understand what was making you feel that way. Additionally, having an option for a morning and evening color scheme would be very pleasant. Having a morning warm color and transition into cool evening color would be really nice. Finally, it is very irksome to have the growth bundle ad constantly pop up when I open the app. I paid for the premium version, I do not need constant ad bombardment for other apps. Despite all this, I am really enjoying the app and plan to use it as my chosen daily mood tracker and journaling. I look forward to more improvements and updates.

Author: abbygee_94
Subject: 3 stars and a half
Body: If I could rate this it’ll almost be 4 stars. I started my subscription, maybe 2 months ago. My therapist wants me to journal my feelings so I can get a better understanding of what’s a feeling and what’s a thought because I really struggle with that. I haven’t been consistent but every time I use the app I love to see the quotes and some of the daily reflections and daily challenges. One big thing I don’t like is that it’s very minimal when it comes or your feelings. There’s really only 5 options to pick from and they aren’t even feelings, they’re adjectives (terrible, bad, okay, good and awesome). From someone who struggles to even identify their feelings, this really doesn’t help. I really hope there’s talk to improve this.

Author: Alejfiebw
Subject: Very Helpful!!
Body: This app is designed for the everyday person. I just recently downloaded the app and it has already been a big help in maintaining my mood. One of my favorite features of the app is that daily, you’re able to write a journal entry about the day, on that day. You’re also able to go back in the calendar and read what you write on that day. A lot of my friends have said that writing things down such as goals, achievements, or even small things about your day can be very beneficial to your mental health. Since I have tried this, it has helped a lot. In my psychology course at CMU, we learned about the breathing method, which is a way to calm yourself when you’re stressed. Another thing that this app also helps with that we also discussed in class is that those with anxiety would like this app because you’re able to track your mood daily! Sometimes this can help those who just want a mood booster, and this app is very helpful in that aspect.

Thank you for the quotes and all other features I mite just have to unlock!

The only part I don’t really like is that whenever you get on the app, it pops up a free trial which I’m not that interested in. 9.9/10 <33

Author: HarryPotterFan4Ever!!
Subject: It’s pretty good!
Body:
Great app! Fun to use, helpful, and its interesting to use. I don’t think I’ve ever seen a journal app like it. In a good way, that is. I only have two suggestions: 

1: it’s an AI app. So maybe you could make it a bit more like AI. What I’m saying is I think you should add an area where an AI thing is. You could talk to it about your problems and things! 

2: I feel like the only way you can actually record your thoughts is through the voice recorder. Maybe you could actually make a journal section? 

Other then that the app is great! Thanks for reading the review and I hope it helps!

Author: TT luna
Subject: A great healthy app to keep habits in track
Body: I love this app a lot. I’ve been very down lately and so far it has helped me. And I need to say that Reflectly is very organized which is satisfying for me with tendencies for everything to be organized and perfect! Not only is Reflectly a great health app, but lately it has also began making me more in contact with my emotions, I usually write a whole big paragraph on Reflectly about how my day was going and what I did, then how that made me feel. They ask how are you feeling that day and how would I rate my happiness, the. What made me happy. This is also a totally free app which is nice considering many health apps these days require money. You can subscribe to this app which costs money, but otherwise you don’t have to and it’s free! No money needed!

Author: Gillian Lowrey
Subject: Really Good!
Body: If your reading this to know what its about, I will try to explain the app the best i can! Or if your just looking at reviews for fun, thats okay too. Reflectly is basically a mini friend inside your phone. If you need someone to talk to and just want them to listen, Reflectly is great at doing that. On the home page, there is a plus sign at the bottom so you can do a mood check in, where it asks you how you are, whats making you feel that way, and how you feel about it. You can write some notes about your day, or just leave it at that. It also gives you motivational quotes and you can choose how many you get at what times. It gives you daily challenges as well that you can choose to complete. I hope this helped you better understand the app! 😊

Author: Kemetrick :D
Subject: Five Stars for Reflectly
Body: This app is really good for your mental health and possibly physical health. It gives you motivation to continue going on in life and fun daily challenges. It also gives you quotes and allows you to journal how your day is. You don’t need to pay for anything unless you want to, this app makes sad to happy.

Author: Toaster_Init
Subject: Mental health not improved.
Body:
Hi, my experience with this app was…decent. After my 4 days of check-ins I expected to see things on how to improve my anxiety so I don’t have to deal with it. Turns out I need to pay to get help. This app is very unhelpful and quite deceiving on the advertisements. I do not recommend if you have 
severe mental health problems or are suffering from depression and anxiety. This app doesn’t help and all it does is send you quotes from philosophers, as if that will help you with your mindset. I am still continuing to suffer from anxiety and this app did not make it better. If I could rate this 0 stars I would. Mental health care should be free and accessible to everyone, not to be charged with fees every month. Thanks for reading this review.

Subject: Unresponsive Team
Body:
I love the app and have found it very helpful for my needs. However I have been trying to export my entries for over a week now and have been unable to. I have sent multiple emails to the app team with no response. It’s very disappointing.

Edit: I have tried multiple avenues to seek help with no response. This app advises you can export your entires and that is a lie. I am cancelling my subscription and will be losing 150+ entries because this trash app won’t do what it promised and it’s support team wont respond or assist. If you have any inclination to want to save your entries after the app DO NOT USE.

QUESTION TO DEVELOPERS!!! some apps like calm are supported by some insurance companies so you can get the paid version. i have medicare or medicade i forgot, but is there any insurance support for it/do y’all plan on implementing that in the future?

Author: G_Fox5678
Subject: Reflecty
Body: This app is amazing. I was feeling really down since my mom was spending the night at her moms and I really missed her. I was crying for a while until I found this app and decided to give it a try. At first I was just looking when I decided to try their daily challenge. It was to make something new (food) or try a new recipe. So I decided to try and make a fruit salad for the first time, it’s not the hardest thing in the world but even though it took me a while I felt so much better afterwards. I depend on this app and don’t know what I would have done if I hadn’t found it.

Subject: Bad account registration process.
Body: Really annoyed. I downloaded the app and immediately put in a super long journal entry, saved it, and then closed the app. I didn’t realize that I hadn’t finished setting up my account so all the work I just did was lost. They should really have you make an account first and then start setting up. When I finally made an account I was spammed with their limited time premium offer or whatever and couldn’t figure out how to get out of it. There was no X symbol. I swiped down even though there was no scroll button and then it said “ignore.” What a waste of my time.

Author: Omggggggggggg234
Subject: Amazing!!
Body: I never write reviews for apps. If I like it I keep using it and if I don’t I delete it, but this app is so good I can’t help but tell others. Truly I never thought this would work because I’ve used other apps and never kept up, but this app gives you fun questions about your history or even yourself and gets you thinking. I’ve never been one for talking/expressing my feelings and this app has been a huge help. I don’t talk to others about my problems, I just write a big paragraph about how i’m feeling on the app. Yes, you have to pay for some things, but it doesn’t get in the overall use in the app. I use the free version and honestly it’s one of the best things to happen to me. Hope this help you make a decision on whether or not to download. I definitely recommend!

Author: Mickey Mouse .S
Subject: I like it! Could use more features though…
Body:
I’m a fan of reflectly, it makes journalling easy especially with my short attention span and busy schedule. 

I like the quotes and the daily prompts, though I wish there was more of the prompts to work with (a section like they have for the quotes maybe). For journalling, sometimes I like to work off of prompts instead of moods so I wish there was a feature that supported that.

I wish there was more versatility and customization in the journalling though; especially since I’m paying for premium and at this point it doesn’t much feel like my moneys worth.

I wish the voice memo thing not only wrote down the words you were saying but saved your voice too in the journal since the translation to text doesn’t always pick up all of my vernacular.

I also wish there was an option to add photos into your journal entries instead of just having them in your timeline.

Overall pretty good, but there should still be many more features added than there are now, especially for premium users.

Also, the regular pop ups for me to buy subscriptions when I open the app are really annoying, especially since I am literally PAYING for premium,, please stop shoving the same constant ‘buy bundle’ package without giving an option to turn off the pop up.

Author: feebcc

Author: Humanpinkiepie
Subject: Don’t bother if you don’t want to pay for the premium membership
Body: The basic functionality is really nice, but it has a couple of interface issues and other problems. The app is aggressive about trying to get you to pay for it. I go to track my mood multiple times a day and have to close the add that blocks the entire screen each time. There is no option for “Don’t see this again” that I can see, and I don’t have money to spend on a subscription for an app I just use to track my mood and nothing else. I think there should be quicker access to the mood tracking option as well. I think the fact that additional things to track, like what’s making you feel the way you are and how you feel about it are hidden and you have to scroll to the side with no prompting to see them made me think there was only one page of emotions and things to track for months until I accidentally scrolled sideways. I’m used to scrolling up and down to see additional options on trackers. Last, some of the “inspirational quotes” they use are actually really high-pressure, anxiety-inducing, and overall just made me feel much worse. I don’t even read the quotes anymore, which is a shame because I liked the idea of inspirational quotes to remind me to track my mood. Things like this make me think about deleting the app from my phone every time I get a notification. You can’t even see the moods you’ve tracked if you don’t pay for premium or get stats/any kind of data that could really help impact your mental health if you don’t have the money to spend on their premium features. The app isn’t really “free,” it’s like downloading a free game and discovering you can’t get past the Home Screen without paying $20.

One last major experience on this app is the fact that it gives you challenges daily to complete. For example get rid of one piece of clothing and take a picture of it. When I log into the app on my iPad, none of my entries sync.  If I hadn’t already paid for a year, I would find a better app that allows syncing.  I will stick with this for the rest of my subscription but won’t renew unless they can make things sync between my devices.

For example, the only negative feelings are “angry” and “down.” I suggest reading Brené Browns book, Atlas of the Heart, where she describes 87 emotions.

Author: Jayceelovee
Subject: Absolutely Terrific App - Needs Work Though
Body:
1. — Needs more options for free members instead of pretty much everything being premium and you losing people due to this. Not everyone can afford what you’re offering and we do love the app but being unable to afford premium to get the features we want and deserve, we uninstall quick and find another app that’s just as good.

2. — Needs the ability to completely black out the app with a total dark mode meaning no white and that will definitely help bring more people in, white is a glaring color and it hurts the eyes after a bit, and it can cause migraines for folks. Also make sure this feature is at least free when you make it, your users will thank you and your ratings will go up instead of down to rock bottom.

3. — We should have the ability to pick our very own accent colors from a color wheel instead of colors you have picked out for us because the colors now are cute and all but I know like many others I’m bored with them and would love to change the color to whatever i wanted, right? Plus this feature would be free of cost so no bad ratings and a lot more happy users.

4. — Can we have the ability to take a photo from the daily challenge screen instead of having to open the daily challenge, see what the daily challenge is, go take a photo, open app, go back to daily challenge, and THEN has to upload it from photo? Like this is so time consuming. Why not just add a ‘Take Photo’ button so we can use our cameras from the app itself and take a photo of what our challenge is, then completely the challenge? This would be so much easier please! Users will thank you againnnn!!!

Thank you for listening. I hope you take some of these to heart, not just for you but for us, the users, as well and you treat us how you’d wanna be treated. Have a good day/night.

Author: Humanpinkiepie
Subject: Great at some things, not at others.
Body:
The basic functionality is really nice, but it has a couple of interface issues and other problems.

The app is aggressive about trying to get you to pay for it. I go to track my mood multiple times a day and have to close the add that blocks the entire screen each time. There is no option for “Don’t see this again” that I can see, and I don’t have money to spend on a subscription for an app I just use to track my mood and nothing else.

I think there should be quicker access to the mood tracking option as well. I think the fact that additional things to track, like what’s making you feel the way you are and how you feel about it are hidden and you have to scroll to the side with no prompting to see them made me think there was only one page of emotions and things to track for months until I accidentally scrolled sideways. I’m used to scrolling up and down to see additional options on trackers.

Last, some of the “inspirational quotes” they use are actually really high-pressure, anxiety-inducing, and overall just made me feel much worse. I don’t even read the quotes anymore, which is a shame because I liked the idea of inspirational quotes to remind me to track my mood.

Overall it’s okay, but things like this make me think about deleting the app from my phone every time I get a notification.

Author: ModTheMan
Subject: Meh at best. Dishonest at worst
Body:
I just started using this app a few days ago. It’s been an alright tool to help keep track of myself and my emotions. Every time you open it tho it freezes for a second then shows the same full page add every single time. You have to scroll down to hit “No Thanks” every… single… time. The app is also somewhat slow and buggy. 

I think the worst tho is the stats. They tease you with them saying “Only X more days of check-ins to unlock your stats!” Then when you finally do… they’re locked behind a pay wall. I could only think “are you for real?” I was led on by the app description and the app itself to believe I’d get these awesome super helpful stats. Too bad it’s all locked behind a pay wall. I might as well just use the default notes app. Daylio is a better option honestly and they are much more upfront about what’s actually available for free. You get stats with Daylio with only some locked behind a pay wall

I really do love the app, but that feature, and having to pay for it, is unnecessary. But again, the app is great! I would recommend it.

Author: bjarkeignar
Subject: This might have saved my life
Body: I generally use this app to be honest with the way my day is going and truly pour my feelings out into something so I can vent. In my lowest day I got a notification that said “even though today wasn’t a good day you made it through so here’s a high five.” That simple line made me laugh and kept me going.

Author: Pippiberka
Subject: Stop with the advertisement already!
Body: I thought this should be a nice and calm app to help me reflect on my days. But since I downloaded the free app have I gotten so many nagging adverts about upgrading. I got the app upgrade after a few days and thought it was over but now it’s the “GROWTH BUNDLE!!!” you want me to buy. No thanks, bye. Good for you that you fooled me once. >:(

Author: MN_ChallengeBros.
Subject: Used it once and deleted it. It stole $60 from me.
Body:
I used this app because a friend recommended it to me. I opened it up and used it for awhile and things seemed pretty good! A pop-up asked if I would like a free trial of premium (I declined.) Afterwards, I deleted the app because it wasn’t quite what I was looking for.
Fast forward a week later (10 minutes ago) I get a notification that $65 have been taken out of my account! Are you serious?! And of course I searched up the TOS and see a big ol’ “ALL SALES ARE FINAL.”

Don’t download this app unless you want your money stolen. This is absurd.

Author: GaelicGremlin
Subject: This is a great app!
Body: First of all, the app understands us better than our peers. We might look like kids being happy going to the park, but deep down, there’s that one thing missing inside of us. Second of all, it listens to all our problems. We don’t need a therapist or a counselor to listen to them. We have the app. As a person who’s struggled with mental health, this app really helps. I definitely recommend.

Subject: What happened?
Body:
I like the app. I liked it enough to buy a subscription. But now every time I open the app, they want me to buy more. Update my bundle! Only $5 a month!! BUY IT!!! WHY HAVENT YOU BOUGHT IT YET?!??

Apparently there is no escape.

And personally I hate quotes especially the happy and cheerful ones because there annoying but I just got this and I get 2 of them tomorrow morning before school so hopefully I feel better but there mostly just icks to me. But overall great app! :)

Author: raiden337
Subject: So far so good but so much advertising!
Body:
The app is beautiful and it’s function simple, I’m a paid premium user but even with this being the case I am bombarded daily with “offers” for other apps within the Reflectly family. It really takes away from what is at its core a mental health app.

Truly disappointing that the dev team has decided to be so aggressive it their up sell attempts, “no” isn’t respected and you’re asked again and again.

Author: Custoz85
Subject: Werbung trotz Premium Abo
Body: Eine schöne App, die ich gerne nutze. Ich habe das premium Abo abgeschlossen. Leider bekomme ich jeden Tag, wenn ich die App das erste mal öffne Werbung, bzw das „Angebot“ für einen „Growth Plan“. Ich zahle Abo Gebühren und bekomme trotzdem beim öffnen jedes Mal diese Werbung. Und diese auch so über den content gelegt, dass ich die Werbung jedes Mal erst wegdrücken muss. Auch in der App selbst wird mir ständig sehr groß das Growth Bundle angeboten. Einen Haufen teils nutzloser oder doppelter free Tools die ich nicht will. Ich habe gerne gezahlt für eine gute App aber dann will ich keine Werbung. Das stört so massiv dass ich dafür ganze 2 Sterne in Abzug sehe. Ich werde das Abo im Anschluss nicht verlängern und die App danach auch nicht mehr nutzen. Für mich deshalb keine Empfehlung.

Author: ElizabethTan
Subject: It works but it’s annoying
Body: Love the inspirational quotes, and I live that you can choose what quotes you want, I just wish that the actually useful ones weren’t blocked by the need for premium. I also wish that every time I opened the app, premium wouldn’t be the first thing I see. I get that you need money and premium has some cool stuff, but can you chill and stop shoving it in my face? Still works, good place to vent when you’re upset and realise how your mood changes throughout the week, in fact, there’s a part of the app that tracks just that! But guess what? I need premium for it. Premium. Premium. Premium. I have anxiety and would like some inspirational quotes to ground myself? There’s a section for that, but you need p r e m i u m. That’s all. Enjoy.

Subject: Love this app!!
Body:
I started using this as a New Years resolution type thing (along with buying myself a planner lol) and it’s actually really nice to be able to put my feelings down and not have it feel like I’m doing a childish diary entry 💀😂 
I love that I can look through quotes and I often find really good ones! 
Also the feature where it asks you simple questions everyday is very nice. I feel like I can be able to better understand myself and describe things about me/my situation with those easy questions. 
I think this was created beautifully and I really have nothing bad to say about this app. 
If anyone has read this far haha I want you to know that I hope you have a wonderful day beautiful stranger ❤️

Author: mysunwolf
Subject: Pleasant App but no support and not worth paying for
Body:
I honestly like the idea of this app quite a bit. It has inspirational quotes, daily challenges, ability to upload photos, and allows you to create daily check ins for your mood with notes attached. If you pay for premium, you can also see your average mood for the past week or month so that you can track trends. The best thing about this app is the simplistic graphic design that is pretty and makes you feel calm. I think it relies on people being content with the interface, and doesn’t have any real substance. There are plenty of other mood tracker apps that do the same thing as this app.

I also wanted to add that I have tried to contact customer support multiple times and have never heard back. I have a couple months worth of entries, and the app absolutely will not export my data so that it will be at all useful to me. This is extremely disappointing after paying for the premium version.

So all in all, some good features and very pretty, but really not that unique or useful.

Author: mthyst
Subject: Great App With A Few Bugs
Body: I like this app a lot so far. I wanted to start out the new year by doing some form of journaling, and this app makes it quick and easy to get in a small journal entry every day. However, sometimes, after I write my daily reflection, it is not letting me save it, so the app does  not acknowledge that I did a reflection on the days where it does not let me save the reflection. Otherwise, it’s a great way to do some soul searching and I would recommend it to a friend if they were looking for a fun method of journaling.

Author: saffora
Subject: reflectly rating
Body: I love this app! i only got it today snd im already obsessed. It helps me vent when im too tired to write, and i love that it gives out inspirational quotes! I highly recommend for people who need a chance to reflect and be listened to, but may not have the supplies, abilities and patience of writing. For example, I have tried and failed to start physically writing in a journal/diary, as at the end of the day i am too tired and normally end up writing too much and tiring myself even more, but this app is free (has a premium option too) and helps much more without extra stress, eg buying new notebooks and pens very often, physical journaling is a good way to let out anger (i do recommend it) however its not just for me, and i feel a little more comfortable typing on a keyboard, and reflectly is already helping me so much! well done to the developers of this app! <3

Author: sofiarebeccabarreda
Subject: Recommend!
Body: I’ve never really downloaded one of these kinds of apps, because I didn’t really believe it would help. This app really changed my perspective. It is so refreshing to be able to write down what you are feeling at any times of the day! I love that it doesn’t limit you to a certain amount of check in’s, so you can  really write down what you are feeling at that moment. I have tried journaling in paper, and I could never really stick with that, so I use to just journal in my notes. With this app I really like the features it provides, and it is very simple. Definitely recommend!

Author: lottie2328
Subject: Helpful Journaling 🌿
Body:
Really good app, has helped a lot - this is my second year of using Reflectly and although I struggle to keep up with daily journaling I find it much easier to cope with using this app. The only downside is that once you start to rely on the app you have to continue with the subscription if you want to keep everything you’ve noted. 

In the whole I am pleased I have kept my subscription as I can log into it on multiple devices (ie Phone/IPad) so I can keep things updated.

Definitely download this app if you are having trouble letting out your emotions.

Author: trump 2020 unter a grave stone
Subject: Amazing app!
Body: I love Reflectly and I don’t even have the paid version. I’ve always struggled with anxiety and depression, and I’ve recently started medication for it. I have trouble reflecting on if the new doses have helped, but Reflectly helps me keep track of my overall mood. I also love that it has daily challenges that helps you grow. I really like this app and would recommend this to anyone who just needs some help with emotions, anxiety, depression, goals, and overall growing as a person.

And in my opinion that’s way to much to pay for for an app. So basically the only things you can do without premium checkins gratefulness and looking at the quotes. But you can’t unlock like different categories of the quotes unless you have premium this app is okay. But I would say don’t waste your time on it. That’s just my opinion though. Maybe just download it and see do yourself. Overall it’s a pretty okay app.

Author: i love this game buuut
Subject: Wonderfull
Body:
This app is a really great way of journaling your day, really nice way of getting your emotions out and having i nice little bubble to dictate and control your emotions—
 
Suggestion: I wish only that the premium subscription would be a bit cheaper, this app is very generous with what comes with the free version which is so incredibly awesome, and for that I would absolutely love to support them and buy the premium package but it’s just a bit much, I sincerely think if they lowered it to 10-25 dollors a month it would be a much more popular option, if the subscription were to be 15 dollors a year or something I would definitely buy it! I understand that’s much less but I think it would definitely be made up with how many more sales they would make, if you are going to do this I do suggest keeping it under 20 for the optimal number of people that will subscribe—

All in all, what you need to take away from this is, DOWNLOAD IT!!!!

Author: abbyavo2010
Subject: Reflectly
Body: It is a really good app to help release your anger in a healthy way. It teaches you journaling skills and you can write a report every day to show how it went. Also it keeps the past journal entries in its memory so you can looks back on them and see how the days went in the past.

Author: 8unnylover
Subject: hmmmmm
Body:
I remember i used to use this before u paywalled literally everything besides just writing ab ur day. It was a great app.

Regrettably, you've now paywalled all of the unique features. Through a subscription rather than a one time payment, no less. I agree that you guys need to make revenue somehow, but seriously? Just make it a paid app instead of pretending its a free app, only to ask the user to subscribe for A YEAR AT A TIME. Subscriptions are just the worst.

You get three stars rather than two for having a password/finger print lock on the app.

Author: Raq123
Subject: Nice interface for Reflectly; Growth Bundle isn’t useful
Body: So far, I like this app for the interface. Mood journaling is very easy to do, and the design is simple and elegant. I checked out some of the other apps in the growth bundle, and I don’t see the value in them at all. I was hoping for much better. The other apps just seem to be collecting data on users. I can’t see how they are more helpful than any other calendar app or task list or health tracker, so I recommend you don’t waste your time.

Author: r0xyz6000
Subject: I love it!! I just have a few issues which I feel could easily be improved
Body:
I recently purchased premium because I do really enjoy the app, although I do have some issues taht I have found with the app taht I feel would be super easy fixes and would make the app more easy to use. Firstly, there use to be a feature where you could search for a certain entry from the graph of weekly statistics. So if you saw a low one you could easily select it and read the entry for that day and remember why you felt low, or vise versa. I found that really useful when looking back at entries and stats. The other issue is that I can’t input a photo and write a entry at the same time. It would be useful to be able to caption photos if I don’t feel like writing an entry but want to make a quick comment which I can remember and include in my overall daily entry. 

I really do enjoy reflectively, I just feel these issues would make the experience more pleasant, 

Thank you

Subject: Really good app
Body:
I literally just unloaded all of my emotional baggage into this smiley face app 😭

But no really, it’s a good supportive place to vent without feeling like you are burdening anybody. It has quotes, customizable emotions, pictures of nature, and more. There’s a pop up to but their ‘premium package’ or whatever, i won’t buy it 🧍‍♂️
That being said the pop up doesn’t get super annoying, it kinda just happens, and then I brush it off.

Overall pretty cool app :)
Oh my friend recommended me Emmo, which is like this app but cuter. So like see ur options before you download. I would switch to Emmo but I’m already emotionally attached to reflective 😭

Author: maudie805
Subject: I mean...
Body:
First the distance between somewhat bad and completely ok is vast. How do I choose one? 

Also, sometimes I just want to start writing, not answer three oddly specific queries regarding my feelings atm. I would simply like to open the app and start writing. 

That aside, I really like the voice recorder option, tho I’m unable to use it often bc I don’t live alone and I prefer to keep my journal private.

Dictation could be improved, tho that may not be through the app as much as my personal phone. 

In conclusion, those are small issues imo. It’s still a very useful tool and doesn’t sell my personal information that I’m aware of. 🤷🏻‍♀️So yeah, I’d recommend it.

Author: Had about enough of this.
Subject: Kind of disappointed.
Body:
I was supposed to get an app to help track my declining mood. For mental health/therapy purposes. 

Everything about this app seemed like what I needed.. Until I found out the the feature- which TRACKS my weekly mood, is locked under a $100 yearly subscription.  I can’t afford that. I don’t want 15 other apps along with this one.  Not once did the app tell me the mood tracker was “premium” only. 
Not to mention, the app constantly reminds you about their subscription deals with pop ups.  

I needed something track my mood, but now I've wasted a week entering my feelings for nothing. 
Thanks for nothing

Author: Unicorn000000011111
Subject: Really Helpful
Body:
Downloaded this app after i tested positive for covid. I was really worried about that and was also feeling very self conscious about my appearance. Reflectly helped me a lot! I have quotes all over my phone, daily challenges have made me so much happier, talking about my feelings made me feel so much better, and at the end of the day reflectly would let me know that everything will be okay and tomorrow’s a new day if i had done a sad check in, and told me that they’re glad i’m happy if i did a positive check in. Really is like having an extra friend that won’t judge you or make you feel down. 

The only thing i will ask is if you could make it so that as well as having daily challenges you have extra challenges on the side, just bc i have covid and i’m really bored so they give me things to do. Could you also add a meditation/ mindfulness part. and also could you add relaxing games that can calm you down? If you can do at least one of them it would make me very happy! Thank you!

Subject: I recommend Reflectly!
Body: Reflectly is really fun. It really gives you a chance to let go of any negative emotions and I always feel good after sharing a feeling. I like this app because you can get some beautiful quotes from it and there is no limit on the amount of mood posts you can post each day. You can also write down what has made you happy, sad or in the middle for that day and it feels really good to be able to share it. It’s also nice to look back at your old emotions on days long ago and compare it to how you’re feeling now! I definitely recommend this to anyone and everyone 😊

Author: UHHM UNFAIR
Subject: Bring back daily reflection questions
Body: This app is nice and all but what I liked most were the daily reflection questions. Now they’ve been replaced with a singular sentence meant to have ONE word filled in 😐 I definitely don’t feel like I’m getting as much from the app as I was before which is really disappointing. And not only this, but the daily quotes are pretty cheesy… If you really want to make progress and reflect meaningfully, you’re better off using a real journal and looking up shadow work questions. As for the quotes, there are plenty of quote apps with much better content.

Author: Daisy_MD
Subject: Impossible to export data!!! ⚠️ Supporto impossibile da contattare
Body: Sono un utente Premium da Febbraio 2020 e mi sono trovata sempre benissimo con l’app! Perfetta per scrivere il proprio diario, ottime le citazioni e le domande quotidiane come spunti di riflessione. La mia valutazione sarebbe stata 5 stelle senza dubbio, peccato che da un paio di mesi a questa parte non è più possibile esportare il mio diario in formato PDF via e-mail. L’assistenza è impossibile da contattare, ho provato a scrivere a ogni indirizzo email fornito dal sito, ma nulla! Zero risposte da DUE mesi, profondamente delusa dal disservizio! 👎🏻 ••••• English version ••••• I have been a Premium user since February 2020 and I always had an amazing time using the app! I found it perfect for writing my journal, inspiring quotes and daily motivation very appreciated. My rating would have been 5 stars without any doubt, unluckily in the last two months I’m experiencing issues with the app: it’s no longer possible to export my diary in PDF format via e-mail. In these two months I tried to contact the Support several times, to every e-mail address provided by the website: no one answered yet! I feel deeply disappointed by this inefficiency 👎🏻 and I really wish someone can help me in this matter, I would be very happy to give 5 stars if I can have my journal back! Thank you very much

Author: Chiara the calm
Subject: Awesome app, definitely recommend!
Body:
I have enjoyed this app so far, and think its great. 

I love how it lets you choose how you're feeling, why you're feeling it and how you feel about it. It really lets me show my emotions and reflect on how I have felt before. It also has quotes which are really motivating for when I am down, and what is great about the quotes is that they are in the same app! 

One thing I would suggest is a journal section where you can just right down whatever you want. (The app might already have this but I haven't seen it yet) 

 Thank you for this app, it has been really helpful to put down my feelings, why I felt it, and how I feel about it. I would appreciate it if you updated the app and maybe even used my feedback. 
Thank you, Chiara

Author: Asomecorgigirl09
Subject: GREAT! But..
Body:
This is a great app, you can do a lot of things without paying for anything!

But… I did the daily challenge and it said I never did it, even though I added a photo. I kept on redoing it about 10 times, but it still did work..

This is a great app though, you can have daily checks ins to see how you are feeling and why you are feeling that way, and after you fill out that stuff you can add a description for that which I like a lot. You can also see quotes, you can pick the themes for the quotes too! Or you can just select general and it will give you random ones :)))

Author: nikki theo
Subject: Glorified notes app
Body: Last year I paid for a yearly subscription of only $24 AUD. Now I’m getting emails saying that this will cost me almost $100 if I want to renew my subscription for the next year. Absolutely baffled as to why it is costing this much - for my purposes, my notes app has the same functionality and yet is completely free. Astounded at the pricing increase as it is almost as much as my Spotify and Netflix subscription. At least these streaming services provide a hell of a lot more value. I will not be renewing my subscription based purely off the absurd pricing.

Subject: WOW! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ PLEASE READ!
Body:
Hey there. 
This app is great and I’m not just saying that. You can still do what the apps meant for even without premium. Also there’s always a great amount of selection or choices to complete. You can read quotes, look at your stats, you can reflect, and say something that your thankful for and why. It’s an amazing app and I would definitely 100% get this app if you are interested in amazing content anywhere from ages 8+. This app lets you reflect more than just once a day; In the morning, afternoon, and evening. It’s always open. It makes you feel piece in your life even when you don’t always have it. When you do have piece it just gives you hope, bless this app. It helps. I was a bit sceptic at first but now I absolutely love it. I’m never getting rid of this app! So far I’ve found no glitches, no problems, and no security issues. Your privacy is guaranteed! Trust me on all of this. Yes, I’m young... but I know a great app when I see one. Have a great day, and thanks for reading. 

Bye.

Author: M. XIII
Subject: Good App for Journaling But…
Body: I’m posting here, because I don’t know where else to discuss. So yes, the app is really good at journaling, and positive affirmations and quotes. HOWEVER, I have two complaints. One is that you can’t insert a page break, and when you convert it into a PDF, it doesn’t work at shows up as (?). Also, they have a VERY aggressive advertisement. Every time you log into the app, it keeps asking if you want to buy this bundle (that never expires, FYI, despite the countdown). Even though you say you’re not interested, it pops up and up and up. Also, the link for customer support doesn’t work either. If you’re listening, it would be nice to revise these features. I’ve been doing it for months, but with the aggressive advertisement and some bugs, I’ve been thinking of transferring to another app.

Author: Daisy_MD
Subject: Impossible to export data!!! ⚠️ Supporto impossibile da contattare
Body:
Sono un utente Premium da Febbraio 2020 e mi sono trovata sempre benissimo con l’app! Perfetta per scrivere il proprio diario, ottime le citazioni e le domande quotidiane come spunti di riflessione.

La mia valutazione sarebbe stata 5 stelle senza dubbio, peccato che da un paio di mesi a questa parte non è più possibile esportare il mio diario in formato PDF via e-mail.

L’assistenza è impossibile da contattare, ho provato a scrivere a ogni indirizzo email fornito dal sito, ma nulla! Zero risposte da DUE mesi, profondamente delusa dal disservizio! 👎🏻

••••• English version •••••

I have been a Premium user since February 2020 and I always had an amazing time using the app! I found it perfect for writing my journal, inspiring quotes and daily motivation very appreciated.

My rating would have been 5 stars without any doubt, unluckily in the last two months I’m experiencing issues with the app: it’s no longer possible to export my diary in PDF format via e-mail.

In these TWO months I tried to contact the Support several times, to every e-mail address provided by the website: no one answered yet! 

I feel deeply disappointed by this inefficiency 👎🏻 and I really wish someone can help me in this matter, I would be very happy to give 5 stars and have my journal back!!!

Thank you

Author: BAiley Bopsssss
Subject: I like the old layout.
Body: I recently just downloaded reflectly again and I noticed that the layout was very different from the 2019 version. It looks great, but I was curious what my old stories/check ins were, but I couldn’t read them, as only a few words were shown. Looking back, I really loved the old layout from 2019 as it was more practical. I loved how you were able to give it a cover and you could tap on it and read your full story, rather than it being a singular line. Other than changing the layout back, the app is great and very therapeutic.

Author: MonoMZ
Subject: Good app, missing a few key features.
Body:
I would like to recommend a few features that would greatly improve my and I'm sure many other users experience.

-being able to star/favorite specific journal entries for easy access.
-more customization with feeling tags and activities: let us edit the default icon layout for tags and activities. it would be more convenient then scrolling to the far right every time for your custom tags. also add the option to delete some of the default tags, the ones I don't use most of time just adds clutter

Author: kgfrederick🌺🐇🦙🦋
Subject: Totally Recommend!💕
Body: Reflectly is an app you can come home (or start of your day) and express your day, and/or how you feel. First, you do your daily check-in. You can write notes about your day, and they can be as long as you want. Say maybe a special event happend, or something really frustrating happend. Next, you can do an optional daily task that can be as simple as a bubble bath. You also have mini-challenges. To all my over thinkers, don’t worry! For an example, today my challenge was “Currently, _____ is the most challenging thing to accept about myself”. I simply had to fill in the blank, no right or wrong answer, just expressing yourself. I have moderate anxiety, and I overthink everything. Oh! Don’t forget the daily quotes. I once got one from Will Smith. I love his movies! Overall, Reflectly lets me get my feelings out and really let it out. Even though you have to pay for certain things like custom quotes, and free access to all of the other apps, I’m inlove. Totally recommend for anybody! Have a great day!

Author: Maria Pilia
Subject: Stupenda
Body:
solitamente nonostante delle applicazioni mi piacessero tanto non ho mai scritto una recensione,ma questa volta lo sto facendo perché mi ha davvero stupida.
avevo reflectly un po’ di tempo fa ma non ricordo bene se era diversa da ora,sta di fatto che non mi piaceva.
ora l’ho riscoperta e WOW.
è fatta benissimo,la grafica è molto molto bella ma semplice e funzionale,non ha ancora avuto nessun bag (nemmeno quelli più piccoli)
sono davvero contenta, ma la cosa che mi piace di più è la sfida di “self care” che ti propone ogni giorno, per esempio oggi la sfida era fare un bagno rilassante con le bolle.
oltre questo adoro la frase che devi completare ogni giorno,la mia oggi era “adoro la relazione che ho con *spazio*”.
davvero stupita lo ripeto,scaricatela! l’ho già consigliata a due miei amiche<33

Author: Soulfruit-Yukine
Subject: Ich liebe diese App!
Body:
Ich finde diese app absolut toll! Man kann jeden Tag mehrere mood-check-ins machen in dem man auswählt wie man sich fühlt und warum. Man kann Bilder hinzufügen und voice Nachrichten. Ausserdem gibt es jeden Tag eine neue challenge wie zb: Ein Bad nehmen oder: Mache etwas wovor du Angst hast. Das motiviert einen aus seiner Haut zu kommen und etwas zu machen, auch wenn es einem nicht gut geht. Zusätzlich gibt es viele Zitate/ Sprüche die man sich durchlesen, speichern und auch teilen kann! Also ich benutze diese App jeden Tag um zu notieren wie es mir geht, um die Challenge zu machen und Schöne Momente mit Bildern fest zu halten. (Habe die kostenlose Version die absolut reicht. Keine lästige Werbung nur wenn man die App öffnet eine Werbung für ein Abonnement was mich persönlich nicht stört) 
Klare Empfehlung❤️

Subject: Pros and cons
Body:
So Reflectivity is a really good app but there are some cons to that, anyone who doesn’t know what a con is it’s just something bad or not so good and a pro is something good.
Anyways so here are my pros and cons to this app:

Cons: 
I have a small problem with this app, you can only do check in’s and that stuff and I really just want something like a journal to right in but with the check in’s you can right down a bunch of stuff 

Pros:
What I like about this app is when you do a check in the app says “hi (whatever your name is) then asks how are you feeling and you will answer whatever your feeling then it will ask you why and you can make a title and some notes (if you want to) another thing I like about this app is when I first got it it’s right away asked what my name is and I liked that because now that’s what it calls me. One more thing, the app has some inspiring quotes on a lot of things and it cheers me up! That’s why I gave it a ⭐️⭐️⭐️

Author: I'mAsh!
Subject: Amazing!
Body: It advertises all the free parts of the app instead of the overuse of only advertising the expensive parts of apps. There’s an unlimited amount of inspirational quotes from the app and famous people, it even gives you a notification with a motivational quote! There’s a daily challenge every day, and it’s completely free and you have 10 hours to do it! You can do a mood check-in of a line, you can move the ‘percent’ of the line to show how good/bad your day has been! If you’ve had a bad day, it asks what’s bothering/upsetting you, if you’ve had a good day, it asks what made it good! You have to do a week of daily check-ups so you can review your ‘stats’. In the app, you even have a sort of timeline off your daily checkups! When you open the app, it asks “I hope my future self is proud of me for______” The __ is where you get to write! It changes daily, today it was “What’s your favourite pair of shoes:___”. I 100% recommended the app.

Author: rach_l_p
Subject: Awful customer service
Body: I upgraded to pay £27.99 for their full “premium” plan only to get a promotion of £8.99 to access all their apps a few weeks later. From what I can gather, this offer is open to new customers too. So not only do new customers get Reflectly for a fraction of the price I paid, they also get all the other apps. For me to access all the other apps I would have to pay the additional £8.99. I contacted customer service who instantly replied but when I clarified my query they have since ghosted me!! I have tried several different emails but with no response. And the most frustrating thing is they keep sending me marketing emails. What a terrible and disappointing way to treat your customers.

Author: sashamf6
Subject: Don’t appreciate
Body: It’s okay to add to the app, but I paid for an entire year of this app and when they changed it, which is fine to do, they took away the morning motivation, which is not fine to do. Adding the question and challenge like they did was fine, but not to replace the best part of the morning. The challenges are mostly worthless and some can’t have pictures. The morning motivation was something I did every morning. I hardly get on anymore now. Why change something good and after you’ve charged people a whole year for the way it was? I at least want a refund. I don’t use it regularly because of that. I no longer have a desire to get on.
