Author: sjaymuller
Subject: Disgusting.
Body:
Recently an friend of a friend used this app to help manage their mood - with faith and hope that the reminders will be in the best interest in his safety; the reminders was along the lines  of suicide. In which not only triggered but traumatised them in even trying to make step for themselves in getting better mentally. 

It’s repulsive 

I don’t know what your intentions are with these reminders but you going to have app for managing your moods, you should be More mindful of your reminders.

Author: lleko22
Subject: great app
Body:
i’ve been using this app for quite some time now and i really enjoy the idea of a diary i can always cary with me.
but for me reading the diary is just as important. if i want to remember how i felt a year ago i have to scroll all the way through (which takes ages if you write every day). 
if the app had a search feature, like searching for a particular date or a title, it would be far more enjoyable. 
now i think a traditional diary, although a bit harder to carry around, would be a better way to document my life in the long run.
and also i love the ‘a year in pixels’ idea of some other apps. it could be great if something like that would be included here.
but overall, the app is still great and i hope it will improve in future.

Overall I really love it it lost a star because of the technical difficulties but I love it and would 100 percent recommend!
Topics: ["Complexity", "Feature Requests", "Notifications & Alerts", "Privacy", "Satisfied users", "Security & Accounts", "Sign Up & Login", "Use cases"]

The only thing is that you do need to pay for a lot of facilities and utilities in the app but since it’s free I can definitely forgive it. Thank you creators for creating this app!

Author: Carlee/Carl
Subject: pretty good.
Body:
amazing app. it has helped me a lot these few weeks.

make sure to set up the account correctly and you may use fake ones if your not comfortable using your real one.

just go to google, switch accounts, add new, create account, put in a email/username you want to use, random password, use it, and there you go!

some adds to buy the subscription will pop up, but im pretty sure it’s only when you open the app. this app has also made me feel more confident. 

thanks for creating this app, 
Your Five Star Review.
Carlee.

Author: vache fachee
Subject: Good with massive flaw
Body:
Mostly an excellent app. Well laid out and encourages you to journal.

But… I HATE having to take photos for the challenges. “Take ten deep calming breaths” and then post a photo as proof? “Smile and say hello to someone as you pass on the street” and then take a photo as proof?!?! It’s just bizarre. I don’t understand why the developers don’t trust us to just say “completed”. Why the need for a photo that is not suitable for a number of challenges? Fix this, and it’d be 5 star.

Subject: why it’s amazing how and why it needs improvement
Body:
I love this app because it affects not just like a therapist but a friend, and the layout super cute and the little smiley face dude makes me so happy lol, there’s a couple things I would change or add.
I think Premium is too expensive, I totally get that the developers need money and that’s how they live. But some people who need help can afford a real therapist or fancy-schmancy apps. So this is what they resort to and I would really like if they added more colors to the layouts. Like customizable colors so you could choose any color you want. :)))))

Author: Nobody whatsoever
Subject: I like this app so far but…
Body: Ok so this app is really great and all but some things I don’t like about this app is that the only thing you can really do without premium is just have mood checks and look at quotes. I got this app thinking it would talk to me about my problems but it doesn’t. I don’t want to have to pay for premium. I get you need money  for the app but I just wish that at least the Reflectly option would be available. Another thing I was really disappointed about was that the habit tracker wasn’t available unless you have premium!!! It is just very disappointing and I hope that you change it because if you did it would make the app better and I would start using it.

Subject: Not for everyone I guess
Body: This app is amazing I think will be great for so many people and it’s amazing what you have done for so many people!!!! I however don’t like the fact that there isn’t an option to skip questions…… I am way too indecisive never had a favorite anything and I can’t tell what mood I’m in, I don’t think I like questions asking these things, I honestly couldn’t be able to tell but either way I’m just sitting there staring at my screen and have no clue what to do. This app is amazing and I think a lot of people should get it but just know that it may not be for everybody so don’t get mad if it’s not for you :) have a great day!

Author: Anya,
Subject: Wonderful! Great for anxiety or mental health issues :)
Body: This is probably the one app of it’s kind that actually unlocks the main functions for free. There’s this app called “headspace” which doesn’t even have the most basic functions unlocked. Everything costs premium. But with reflectedly you can do exactly what it promises, document your day and mood. After 5 mood check-ins you unlock stats where you can see all your mood comparisons and it tells you the common cause of your bad moods. Even though yes you can pay for extra quotes and some other features the base app is still amazing and as a free user I definitely recommend it.

Author: djdjdnchidm
Subject: Great, but one improvement
Body:
I really love reflectly for a few reasons. I love the mood tracker and journaling, I think it helps you record how your feeling with lots of details. Though one thing made me start avoiding the app. Sometimes I feel multiple emotions and some of those emotions can be absolutely different even if i am feeling them in the same moment. I’m sure lots of people can also relate to that. So I think it would be great if reflectly came out with an update where you could record multiple feelings in one mood report. 
Thanks you for your time.

Author: bshjan
Subject: Mental Health
Body: This app has made my mental health so much better. I haven’t payed for the subscription, but at this point I like the app so much that I might. I can schedule when I want the quotes. Speaking of the quotes, they are just amazing you can go through and find you favorites then save or share them, you can get many each day and choice when you get them. Each day you do a daily check in so how is you day going and why, then, you choose something good about that you are thankful for or something you are good at. Overall it is just a great app. I got it when I saw an add for it and was not expecting to love it this much or for it to have such a positive impact on my life. I highly recommend this to anyone especially people who struggle with mental health, but I think everyone needs this app. Reflectly has mad my life better and easier to go through each day I highly recommend this app to everyone.

Author: Syd12175020
Subject: Great idea, just wish the app was more complex
Body:
So I’ve been dealing with a few mental illnesses and i have many similar apps on my phone. I really like being able to reflect on my day. The app format makes it easy to scroll and see exactly what I was thinking just the beginning of the week and reflect on how that changed. 

My main concerns are the app being too basic. Reflection is complex, there are more factors than “work, relationship, family” that would affect my mood. I wish there were many more on the app, and a chance to add your own factor/stressor/trigger and icon. I’ve seen this on similar apps. 

I really love the voice to note option, but wish it didn’t require me to hit record again after every 60 seconds. I also wish there could be a voice memo option. Honestly after having to hit record every minute I usually leave the app and go to voice memo to finish my thoughts uninterrupted. 

If these were added I’d definitely buy the app, but I still feel like I have to use a variety of apps to find what im looking for. Great idea though!

Subject: It was better before, but still a good app
Body:
Im going to be honest, i stopped using the app a bit after they added the subscriptions a while ago. I understand that they need to make a profit somehow, and it is selfish and inconsiderate of me to even say this, but i think before it just felt more genuine before. The layout before was better as well imo, it looked a lot more homey back then, now it looks a lot more professional, but kinda too professional, and it stopped giving me daily questions, which were probably my favorite thing, i think you have to pay for them now, im not really too sure. After all those updates i lost motivation to wright about my days and stuff like that. :( 
But the idea for this app is nice, and the fact that it sends you a couple of notifications a day to check up on you also made me happy. The app is helpful if you want somewhere to vent to yourself, i do think its a good app in general, and would recommend it to people.

I also like that even though there is a subscription, the free version you get is perfect also, so to anybody that doesn’t like subscriptions or thinks that in order to have decent access to the app you have to get it, you really dont have to, trust me i’m the same way lol. i really do recommend this, even for people who dont write much, cause this review is coming from somebody that does art, no writing, and to be honest i really really enjoy it, i hope you all do too! see ya!

Author: idun :))
Subject: Helps me with my mental health.
Body:
Reflecty really does help me with my anxiety. Sometimes you feel like you have no one to talk to, that youre locked in this cage of rage against evrything and everyone. Reflecty listens. It also doesnt take alot of time, so when im not feeling like writing a 1000 word paragraph abt how i feel; i can simply write a short text, or even no text - only emojis. 

I love this app ALOT! My rating is, like it is, because it really does live up to the 5 stars. I would love an emoji that said and visualised “restriction” as it is something i feel like a majority of people feel about certain things sometimes. 

Thank you for this app!!!

Author: ILoveDarkness-2409
Subject: Amazing app
Body:
Reflectly is does exactly as the app name says it allows you to do daily check in’s and reflect on yourself. I used to be insecure but now I feel more confident just by scrolling through these quotes everyday, I used to feel really sad and I had to improve on moving away from those who I don’t deserve, and being more confident in my choices. I’m definitely not the one to write a huge paragraph about these apps but there is so much to talk about this app on how you can get a crazy amount of support on your health, your mental health and so much more I feel more open now but not really at the same time I get to be more open and honest with something that won’t judge me by any cause. Overall this is a great app to grow and improve on things your having trouble expressing, feeling, etc..

UPDATE!! I have had this app for about a year now and it’s a really life changing for me personally I think it’s a great app. Definitely download this reflectly will not disappoint you.

Author: #Coronavirusisdeadlytobullies
Subject: Great for emotional support
Body: Hi my name is Hannah! So I have ADHD and basically I was diagnosed with it at age of 6. Later my therapist  recommended this app so I won’t feel alone. This app helped me to talk to someone or anyone about  how I felt without feeling excluded. I fully recommend this app for ages 7 and up if you ever need moral support or company. You can daily do a self-check to see how you are feeling and check people’s quotes for inspiration!! People won’t even judge you for who you are on this app!!! I’ve been using this app now since 4th grade and this helped me getting through my fears of starting at new schools!!! Whoever made this app, I want to thank so much for helping me feel comfortable around myself and for helping me a lot when I’m down.

Author: Edwin10456
Subject: I love it!
Body: This app is so great :) And it works. You do have it get a subscription to unlock certain things but the app is definitely usable without one. The app has a feature where you can talk about your day verbally or write it down. Whatever you are more comfortable with. Not only this but, you also get the option to turn on your notifications and it will remind to do a “daily check in” One in the morning, afternoon, and night. Any other check ins you do can be completely up to you! You can do as many as you please and throughout the day if you’d like. Its private so no one can see what you write down there wether it’s venting about a bad day or putting a picture to show how great your day was. It’s like your own personal digital journal. It also gives motivational quotes, and every Sunday you can practice thankfulness. If your looking for something to help with your mood if your feeling down or if you even wanted something that you’ll be able to take wherever with you without taking to much space up in your bag then this is the app for you! Have a great day! 🤍

Author: no-thanks_
Subject: Well it seems pretty cool, just o ne issue...
Body:
When I saw an add for this on Instagram, I thought it seems like a good idea for me to download! I have only been using this app for about a good 10 minutes and the app does its job pretty good, but I have one complaint. The “back to school sale” screen is really difficult to get out of. I have an iPhone 12, so I don’t have a home button.
 But as soon as I open the app I get hit with the “back to school sale” screen. My problem isn’t the fact that there is a sale on a purchasable item. It’s the seemly purposeful placings of the buttons. The button to leave the “back to school sale” screen is 1. A small button 2. RIGHT beneath the “redeem” button 3. EXTREMELY difficult to interact with because of my “home button” of sorts.
So when I open the app to use it, I always end closing the app again out of frustration of not being able to leave the screen and not accidentally purchase something I don’t want. 
Overall though, the app seems useful and the motivational quotes are nice.

Author: Nadda.Mercenary
Subject: Helps Me Vent
Body: I’ve been having tough times with my boyfriend I feel like I’m talking to a friend about my problems and it makes me feel like I pulled so much off my chest. I believe the voice feature helps me the most because it actually feels like I'm speaking to somebody I love and trust, 5 Stars ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Subject: Would recommend :)
Body:
This app is really sweet and a great way to express your feelings. I love the quotes you get throughout the day too!! My friend has recently had to deal with a breakup so I recommend this app to her and she was constantly sending me screenshots of messages and quotes. She’s feeling better already. 

It’s also great that it’s for all ages and you can still do so much even without a subscription!! Ive had it myself for around a month and a half and it’s lowered my anxiety levels greatly. I like reading back on my first entries and seeing how much more confident I have become.  

Would sooooo recommend to anyone! Even if you aren’t worried or stressed, it’s a great way to reflect on your day and talk about things! Thank you so much for creating this app it’s helped my so much throughout this tough time in my life, thanks again!!!

Author: Rose Beef Au Jus
Subject: I’d give this app 5 but…
Body:
Downloaded the app, got the offer to go premium, “no thanks, at least not until I try it a bit” I thought. I’ve been using it for a few days and I really like it

EXCEPT

the only notifications/badges I have are to ask me to go premium. There’s literally a badge every single time I look. Is it a reminder to enter a check in? No it’s a reminder that I’m not premium and should be. Even without the badge active EVERY. SINGLE. TIME. I open this app it asks me to go premium. 

The developers need to do some user testing so they understand how unbelievably greedy and annoying that is. I’m happy to pay for extra services, once I know I’ll use the app and get used to entering check-ins. I actually do really like it, but this whole PLEASE BY PREMIUM feeling is very off putting. I’m ready to make an entry that just says “bad mood, this app keeps asking me for a subscription at every turn I make”.

Ask me when I click on a feature that’s premium sure. Or once a week ask. Even in a notification! But multiple times a day? Probably the most annoying pay wall reminder I’ve ever experienced. Where is your UX team? They are failing and you’re probability loosing potential customers. I’ll be deleting the app soon I’m sure. I’m barely hanging on b/c of the design and interactions being well done.

Author: ThePrada21
Subject: The Modern Journal with AI
Body:
In today’s society we live our lives connected and full of media in social platforms online events and eve more now than ever due to the pandemic and distance that has come into effect. I truly fell in love with this App due it’s great modern design and high quality levels of deep integration for the daily routine and updates of your agenda. The App is friendly and has such a nice touch in complex task and more for a view in the end of week or month. At times when people need a break to relax the stress of the day so they can adjust everything at hand this App helps me greatly. It’s like sending a tweet for an update of the day and I love it. The best part of the App is it learns from your pattern of daily or weekly updates for better understanding and more positive alignment in the future tasks of events that occur. I love this App for the modern design and great simplicity in the user experience for a great time. 

Thanks

Author: TangerineTangent
Subject: Clunky and gimmicky
Body:
I was looking for a journal app and found this one...I used the premium subscription for awhile cuz I liked the way it charted and showed moods over time...but I Just can't use it anymore. It's very hard to type and see what you're typing  (small white font on blue background) and the whole point of the app is for writing! I couldn't go back and edit very easily.
I also found it very annoying to have to categorize my mood before I started an entry, because for me the point of journaling is to work out how I feel and why. You have to go through two screens just to write down your thoughts: 1) asking how you feel and 2) what categories are making you feel that way, And HOW YOU FEEL about that. How do I feel about how I feel?? Annoyed that I have to quantify all that before writing about my day.
It crashed on me a few times and always seems slow to load/open. Once I stopped using the paid version it would open every single time with an ad for premium. How many times do I have to say no thanks before you get it?!
I found a simpler journal app that works for me without all the unnecessary floofy little Smiley's and moods.

Author: jennakatherine
Subject: This app is amazing!
Body:
I’ve recently been struggling with my mental health and love to write down my thoughts. I always stop writing in my journal after a while so I wanted an app that can send notifications on my phone. After trying 10+ goal organizing apps, Reflectly is the one that stuck.

Reflectly has so many features such as the voice note that I love. It helps me cope with my anxiety and ocd by being able to share my thoughts. Reflectly also provides a log of how you’re feeling everyday and reasons why. This is great way for me to get some of my stressors off of my chest.

Reflectly also provides the features that I love for free! Usually apps like these have very little things that you can do for free, so I love that I can write notes, answer questions, and read notes without having to pay anything!

Overall, Reflectly is a great app for people young and old; it can help you so much through the hard days.

Subject: Paid twice and app still didn’t recognize payment
Body: I wanted to love this app. I paid the special offer price, it’s on my credit card. But the app confused me when it said I didn’t have the premium I had just paid for. I clicked to subscribe again (thinking it would recognize I had already paid) and got billed a second time at full price!! So I’ve essentially paid $100 and can’t use the features. I have since requested a refund from iTunes and not sure they will grant it. So I paid twice and have no premium app access. If someone can rectify this issue I will gladly remove the review. The app support didn’t work through the app.

Author: Kennady Handeland
Subject: Reflectly help out
Body:
When i first started using this app i was a little skeptical and now i use it everyday. I didn’t  end up buying premium but you don’t have to… it is fun no matter what it gives you positive quotes everyday and you can even choose how many you get and when you get them. After so many day you get to start writing your own wisdom quotes for the app!
So far i have found so many quotes that make me laugh and that have made me a better person. So don’t listen to all those bad comments on this app and focus on the positives. When you fist get this app it says that you have to buy premium but there are either No Thanks buttons or X’s in the top corner.

Author: treqpert
Subject: A lot of things could be improved
Body:
I’ve been looking for a journal app for quite some time but all of them are very expensive. I got Reflectly and I was offered 80% off so I subscribed to it.

Issues I have with the app:
• profile picture is rotated 90 degrees and it’s pretty annoying (I imagine it must be even more annoying to people with real OCD; the app should help, not exaggerate mental illnesses)
• contact support button doesn’t work
• no widget option
• no Apple Watch support
• I wish to see a habit (journal) tracker to keep me more motivated to journal
• instead of a list of entries in a chronological order, I’d love to see a calendar
• I’d like to filter my entries based on feelings and activities
• I don’t want to see an app badge whenever I’m notified of a quote
• biometrics isn’t working well. It makes me do Face ID 2 times for no reason and there’s no option for a passcode. Super annoying!!!
• would be nice to be able to change the app icon
• daily prompts should allow me to write longer entries 
• the note section should maximize to the whole screen because it feels like I’m supposed to write a sentence or two when there seems to be little space. 

Pluses of the app:
• nice design
• easy to use
• daily prompts
• motivational and inspirational quotes

Overall, good idea but poorly executed app. Please fix some of the things that I’ve mentioned above! We’ll see how the app progresses but for now, I give it 2 starts.
Topics: ["Bugs", "Camera & Photos", "Complexity", "Design & UX", "Feature Requests", "Frequency", "Dissatisfied users", "Notifications & Alerts", "Pricing", "Use cases", "Devices"]

Author: Hanako Light
Subject: Great at first though wish parts didn’t change.
Body: This is such a great app. I won’t deny that. It was always there when I needed someone to vent to because I’m the therapist friend and it was a great way to track my episodes. Though sadly, the app became limited in what it can do. I was using the app for a good while before it changed. I remember when you got the Daily Inspiration quote for free and it always helped me in the mornings. I remember when there wasn’t the premium option and everything was free. Though I do miss those times, I do not blame the makers for changing it. This is still a great app and I highly recommend it for people who need someone to talk to; even if some of the best parts are no longer accessible to people who cannot buy Premium. I just miss having it be open to you without any paywall. Though I will say that it did help with many bad days of my life and helped me track how bad my episodes where and how I coped with them. Great app, but 4 stars because of the paywall.

Author: esthi2.0
Subject: Kleine Kritik
Body:
Mir gefällt die App sehr gut, da man immer einen guten Überblick über sein Erlebtes und Gefühltes hat. Die App erinnert ein auch ab und zu, was ich gut finde, da man es sonst vergisst und das ganze etwas seinen Sinn verliert. 
Ein Kritikpunkt: man wird zuerst gefragt, wie es einem geht. Das kann man auf einer Art Skala angeben. Dann wird man gefragt, warum es einem so geht. Aber es gibt nur 9 verschiedene Kategorien, wie Familie, Freunde, essen etc. Eines fehlt aber: “Ich”. 
Oft sind es nicht die äußeren Einflüsse, die einen so fühlen lassen, sonder man selbst ist einfach im Konflikt mit sich oder einfach “in love” mit sich. Das wäre mein Besserungsvorschlag.

Author: fire fly willow
Subject: Awesome app
Body:
This app is amazing. It gives you a perspective. It’s so good and helped me a lot. It help me understand my feelings. Also the inspirational quotes are very reassuring. But the “stats” icon which tells you your mood stats and how your moods had either fluctuated or stayed the same has now only been available in the premium version which you have to pay for. Also you only get to do two free daily “reflections” which are actually extremely helpful, before it becomes not free anymore and then you have to purchase premium.
But overall this app is very helpful and I love it! Please get it, it’s a great app that is great for when your feeling down and you do this amazing things called mood check ins which asks you how your feeling, why that is and how do you feel about feeling this way! It’s an amazing thing and helped me and hopefully many people also.

Subject: Money grubbing
Body: I got the app just last night. I was able to make an account and set it up, did my first check in. After that, it was all downhill. I wasn’t paying for the premium version so I kept getting a screen about it. The problem is, I can’t get out of that screen. The “No thanks” button is right where the area you swipe to get to your home screen. I’m using an iPhone XR. Every time I try to click it, I either click the purchase button or swipe out of the app. I thought once the counter counted down, I would be free. I was wrong. A new deal popped up and it had the same issue. I’m looking for another app. This was unnecessarily stressful.

Author: TheDolphinBoy
Subject: What happened to the daily reflections???
Body: When I used this app a while ago, I was able to do daily reflections for free, and I enjoyed it. Then for a while (over a year), I stopped using the app because I didn’t think I needed it at the time. But recently, I got back into the app and it won’t let me do the daily reflections anymore unless I pay, which I won’t. Pretty much the only thing I can do is right in a journal, which I could just do using the notes app. You cannot just give us something in this app and then take it away like this. I understand that you need to make money but even before, there were already enough features that needed payment to be accessed. What you’ve done is boil this app down to a notes app. Make daily reflections free again!

Author: Soapmaker😄
Subject: Great app but is expensive
Body: I always try to keep a journal but give up after a week. This is a great alternative that is super easy. I like how you don’t even have to write anything (other than a title) if you don’t feel like it. Contrary to some other reviews, you do not have to pay to use it. Yes, there is a premium subscription that is pretty expensive, but you can also not use it. I recently got premium for a discount because the app gave me an offer (that made it only 15 $ for the first year) and I’m really happy with the features. You can see your weekly/monthly mood breakdown which is nice. Also, it gives you a reflection prompt everyday. In conclusion, I’d say that this is a great app that you should download even if you don’t want the subscription (which is probably a bit expensive for what it is).

Author: justthatlonleygirlinthecorner
Subject: Has helped me a lot.
Body: It’s unusual for me to give apps five stars. However, I just had to give Reflectly the rating. I’m on a journey (like I’m sure many of you are too) to better myself. I’ve dealt with problems like chronic loneliness which has led to quite intense anxiety. So I was scrolling through some apps as a small gesture for myself, I was looking for some good journaling apps or apps that keep track of my mood. That’s when I came across Reflectly. I was jumping into the app with high hopes and was pleasantly surprised. I’ve used the app for a while now and yes, after some deletions and reinstalling. I’m sticking with the app. It’s just a simplistic way to get that extra bit of motivation to get you through the day. Bottling things up is extremely unhealthy. So if you feel you can’t tell someone writing them down either electronically or physically is a way to help. I’ve chosen Reflectly because of the layout. It’s really simple to understand and I can easily access previous written journal entry's. Do I recommend? Definitely.

Author: jsifh
Subject: My thoughts ✌️
Body:
So I’m an 11 year old girl who has been stressed lately, the other day as I was scrolling on the App Store, I came across Reflectly, ever since I’ve got it I’ve felt happier, more myself and most improved, my confidence, this app is such a booster and now I’m ready for the world, I suggest a morning checkup then an evening, as that’s what I do, but do whatever works for you 💕
But the reason that this is a 4 star not a 5 is because it’s slightly (slim to none) annoying on how there’s only certain things you can do without a premium, but apart from that, I truely feel this is the best app I have on my phone, I’d like to thank all the creators, helpers and the people who made and grew this app, definitely recommend this app

                     Rachel~11💖

Author: Parlour princess
Subject: Life Changing - Great for Mental Health
Body:
For someone who dreaded the boring uninspiring diary apps I have tested, I love this highly recommended. I would go so far to say it has changed my life for the better.

I have not used a diary/journal for 30 years. Using this app has been a delightful experience. I started off with the free version, but after a week decided to pay for the advanced mode. A really worthwhile purchase.

I love the colours and colour choices. The inspirational quotes are great. I like the reminders and the mood check in is a helpful way of keeping track of your moods and emotions. 

It has changed my life, as it inspires me to think about how I am, how I'm feeling, what is really on my mind. I'm so pleased I found this during lockdown. It has been my salvation and support.
Instead of shoving my thoughts and feelings away, I can express them freely and feel positive and calm as a result. Great for mental health

Thanks so much to the developers 😀

Author: E. Thomas
Subject: Poor customer service
Body: I downloaded and used it for a couple of weeks. I got charged for the premium service even though I didn’t make the purchase a few days ago. The annoying part was that somehow it didn’t know that I was a premium member and it continued to offer to sign me up. I got fed up with the situation so I contacted Support by emailing it. After waiting for more than 24 hours without a response, I decided to delete the app and contacted my credit card company to get my refund. I’m very disappointed with this company and I will stay away from its future products.

Author: meowmisery
Subject: Super cool app
Body:
I really enjoy this app. Iv been needing a journal again but I write so much my hand starts to hurt so I stoped journaling. Well that didn’t help. I need to get my thoughts out one way or another or they reply in my head. So I was on reddit for a while… that doesn’t last long because even in the most wholesome subs you get trolls, and one troll can ruin everything you’ve worked on. 

So I googled journaling apps and this popped up. It’s very versatile and has a lot of cool features. Quotes everyday, reflection prompts and then you have your check ins. And this is huge you can type them, use voice to text or if a photo says a thousand words you can always add a photo for your check in. It tracks your check ins and after a while you can start to see what might keeping you going and whats pulling you down. You can set it to remind you to check in, but honestly after you do it a few times you really love it find yourself just checking randomly throughout the day. Like before a class or after dinner. 

I love this app, I got the full version before the first week was up. It has helped immensely and I can also bring it with me and easily go over my month with my therapist.

Author: Geeoorrgee
Subject: Not sure how AI is involved?
Body:
Essentially this journal app is like literally any other: providing a space for you to tag and write journal entries along with attaching a mood. You can then track this mood line-graph over weeks or months. I’m guessing the revolutionary AI part is the random therapy-like questions you can also fill out that change daily, like “what would you like to tell someone close to you” or “what can you walk away from?”. I’ll let you decide if these help you or not. 

Other than that, its just the same as taking a notes page and writing down your thoughts and tagging it. I’ll be cancelling my subscription

2 stars because it actually functions unlike many apps out there, and the colour scheme is nice.

Author: lapis_unchained
Subject: Clever idea
Body:
I think this app would be GREAT for therapists and those in therapy. Been in therapy for 6 months and it’s hard to keep track of my thoughts and emotions for the entire week, the fact that AI helps you understand things is something I haven’t experienced yet as I just download the app a minute ago, but perhaps providing a dashboard for therapists to see the raw data of their patients and other useful tools would be a great addition. The only hurdle with this though would be data privacy. 

Also got this app because I’m learning flutter. The UI is very pretty, but at times kind of unintuitive and leaves me stumbling momentarily to figure out how to do something basic like editing a note. 

Lastly, most of the animations are choppy and new scenes are slow to load. For example, tapping on the icons in the bottom navigation bar have a very noticeable delay and is something I haven’t experienced with other apps in a long time (currently on iPhone 12 mini, IOS 14.5.1).

Would love to see this app become more popular in the mental health/social work field!!

Author: s1r muffin
Subject: Not that great
Body:
So the features are good, and all that, yada yada yada. It keeps screaming at you to buy the subscription (in Canada it’s $80 a year). Not a good way to keep saying “buy this thing that you will practically never use for $80”. On top of that, it runs as smoothly as Microsoft Flight Simulator on an NVIDIA GTX graphics card (in 3 words: like a potato). 
Not that good of an experience.
4/10

Author: Maude-Victoria
Subject: Coup de cœur ❤️ Il faut payer un abonnement pour continuer à l’utiliser!
Body: Sincèrement j’ai adoré! L’app est simple à utiliser et super. Je conseille à ceux qui veuilles tenir un journal intime (dans mon cas) ou un journal de bord (etc.) mais qu’il ne veulent pas écrire ou qui ce tanne ou qu’il l’oublie. C’est parfait pour vous! L’app vous donne des notifications si vous oublier le d’écrire quelques chose (etc.). Très interactifs.  On peut mettre des photos .Le bémol est qu’il faut payer un abonnement pour continuer de l’utiliser et elle n’est pas disponible en français pour moi qui est vraiment poche en anglais ( j’ai dû utiliser Google traduction à certains moments).
Topics: ["Camera & Photos", "Complexity", "Design & UX", "Feature Requests", "Internationalization", "Notifications & Alerts", "Pricing", "Satisfied users", "Use cases"]

Author: Rinderhackbraten
Subject: Absolvierte Bezahlung ohne Bestätigung
Body:
Leider habe ich diese App vor ein paar Tagen installiert. Es wird von vorne herein unumgänglich mit Werbung für premium geworben. Aus den Auswahlmöglichkeiten war nicht klar ersichtlich welche nun zum NICHT kaufen führt. Leider habe ich hierbei auf continue gedrückt und nicht auf ein gleichfarbiges X in der rechten oberen Ecke. 
Es wurde direkt und ohne vorherige Bestätigung ein Abo abgeschlossen für ein Jahr im Wert von 32€. 
So weit so gut lässt sich sowas noch verkraften, blöd nur das nun trotz dem Kauf welcher Aus versehen getätigt wurde immer noch Werbung für einen weiteren premium Kauf angezeigt wird. Meiner Meinung nach ein absolutes NoGo.

Author: sukEEt
Subject: The app has charged me 2 for a year and it doesn’t even work!!!
Body: The app seems like it would be good, but I accepted the introductory offer of a year of premium and it would not recognize that I have a premium account. It continued to ask me if I would sign up for a year. Then when I tried to fix this, my account got billed for a full second year! No one from the company has addressed this, so I am hoping that Apple can sort this out. Even though I have been charged twice it still shows that I have a basic account … almost 100 euros and no service … if there was a negative rating, I would give them one … buyer beware.

My skills coach and therapist have also said this app is great for me due to my ptsd and my manic bipolar, because I can use this app to write out what’s on my mind, track my mood, and even log important things on it so my short term memory issues aren’t a problem as much. So yes I give it a five star and say thank you for the great app...now I jus wish I could pay for the full years expansion for it.

Author: VictoriaSilvis
Subject: Incredible app for nurturing your mental and emotional well being + some feedback
Body:
Hello developers of Reflectly, 
I’ve been using your app for a while, and feeling Hello developers of Reflectly, 
I’ve been using your app for a while, and feeling little bit more better managing my emotions reading positive affirmations, check in my recording my mood, and so on and so forth. Some things which could be improved is include more emotions, and unfamiliar emotions when logging to check in with how you’re feeling. There isn’t good selection of moods or emotions so I would appreciate if there’s a feature to record down the emotion or add way more moods, and unfamiliar moods. 

Another one is many developers who makes apps includes subscriptions, and I appreciate the discount to pay per year. I think it would be more fair if there’s one time payment that’s not overly priced, and affordable, there are people still out there who can’t stand subscriptions, and instead of complaining I use the free features, and it would’ve nice if you include a one time payment which is affordable to get access to all the features. 

Overall it’s a well built app, although I like to recommend the developer if we could customize, or add our own images we get from the internet to our own liking for positive affirmations, and customizing your profile where every iOS users sees an image of their profile picture, and other wonderful things on the app. It’s a really well made app and I’m glad there are people who actually cares for peoples mental, and emotional well being.

Author: Great app ! love it!!
Subject: Awesome app!
Body: Lets start off with how AMAZING this app is! This app calms me down when i do check-ins and lets me kind of express my feelings when there is nothing to express them too. I also love the inspirational quotes i get everyday, and how i get to chose how many times a day i get them ( I personally set mine to 8 x a day)! And i love how i can view my stats , i also love how you get to CHOSE if you pay for premium and if you don't you still get let into your app and get to experience other features unlike other apps.. and to end off my review it is amazing and i definitely recommend it ! Its not like other diaries and then again keeps me calm because Reflectly asks me questions that if i was writing in my diary i would just be straight forward, wright about it and be done! But here they ask you questions so its like talking to a person but now having secrets and people talking about it and sharing things that happened to you when its none of there business( i experience that alot). Then again i love this app and I totally recommend it! Get it if you don't have it already! Thanks for reading , bye!

I tend to forget every days and why I was feeling sad but with this I can jot it down quick and show my therapist. Even having the weekly mood tracker is great for when they ask me how I was during the week and I can give a real response instead of just “fine”

They asked which version and phone I was using. The version was literally in the subject field. But ok. I sent my version and phone info. That was 5 business days ago. Nothing back and I’m out 25$. There must be better apps out there. This one isn’t helpful. It’s a mental health app and it just was nothing but aggravating.

Denn immer wenn ich darauf Tippe, öffnet sich ein Angebot für Premium. Aber wenn ich dann auf „No Thanks“ tippe, sind beide Fenster geschlossen.

Aber ich finde diese App trotzdem sehr gut und würde sie jedem empfehlen.

Subject: I hate to say this..
Body: I’m not one to make negative reviews. I understand making an app takes a lot of time and dedication, and I only rated this two stars because up until three days ago I loved this app. It made me feel productive and more relaxed once I went over my day. I LOVED IT. However, I guess with the new update, now we have “limited space” to journal. That is really frustrating because we already don’t have all the features for free, and now you take away the free journaling altogether? That’s pretty lame. I don’t want to spend $59.99 a MONTH just to have an app about journaling. I understand you need to make money as developers but come on! I loved your app because it provided a good service FOR FREE, and now it doesn’t. Simple as that. Get this app. Go ahead. But just know time is going to run out and you’ll have to pay to journal with no perks. I loved Reflectly, now I hate it. Come on developers.

Author: Damilta
Subject: The app lied about giving me a discount
Body:
In the app I was offered a subscription deal which was 16.49 euros for the entire year, which is a 75% discount from the original 66.99 euro offer (which I can’t afford). This offer is available for 24 hours so I go to purchase it and once the payment menu comes up (from Apple) and it shows you the price down at the bottom. Instead of the discounted price I was offered, it still said “66.99 euros” which is the original price. This is ridiculous because some people could actually miss this misunderstanding (or whatever it is, a scam??). 

Reflectly, seriously? Come on. I could’ve accidentally payed for something I didn’t sign up for. Isn’t this illegal? You’re promising customers a discount and then tell them to pay the original price (technically without telling them that they’re paying the original price). What if I didn’t realise that the cost didn’t get reduced? I would’ve payed the whole 66.99 euros! 

In summary: Reflectly offered a 75% discount on the premium version and when I went to pay for the discounted offer, it asked me to pay the original price which is 66.99 euros instead of 16.49 euros.

Subject: Ok

Det är inte heller så simpelt som ett kryss i hörnet utan nästintill den andra knappen som startar ett abonnemang. Väldigt tråkigt och dåligt tycker jag, borde räcka att tacka nej en gång och inte varenda gång man använder appen!
Translated Body: Before I had given this app 5 stars, I use it often and like how they work, but since a while back I have to press "no thank you" every time to pay and get a subscription, this is EVERY time you open the app. It is also not as simple as a cross in the corner but almost the second button that starts a subscription. Very boring and bad I think, should be enough to say no once and not every time you use the app!

Author: bcnsbcbs
Subject: Great app, but the paywall is a little irritating
Body: I’ve been using this app for about a week now, and I love it already. The look and feel of it is really nice, and I just generally love the aesthetic and all the little things you can do with the little emotes in mood check-ins. However, I wish that reflections weren’t locked behind a paywall, but I do still love the app though, especially the reflections. I love that it gives you a more specific question to think about and write something about that isn’t just “How are you?”, and I wish I could use it more because it generally puts me in a better mood.Overall, love the app and would recommend, even if just for keeping your thoughts straight like I use it for.

Author: gfjdncnjdjf
Subject: This is a good app
Body: I actually really really really enjoy Reflectly, it’s makes me happy to write how my day has been, no matter the fact you have to pay for some stuff. No matter the amount of times I use this app in a week there is one thing that bugs me the “inspirational quotes”. At first their good and stuff but some of them are down right blaming all your problems on yourself or just aren’t inspirational. For example after I had an anxiety attack today I went on the ones concurring anxiety and basically the majority of them where like “OH ALL YOU HAVE TO DO IS NOT WORRY” when in reality it’s not as simple as that. I have one last thing to talk  about, the mental health inspirational quotes (look I get you guys have to get money some ways but still this is really wrong and disgusting to me) I think the depression and the PTSD ones shouldn’t be locked. There’s something weird and I don’t know sus about sorta having them locked like that, it gives off this weird vibe that ur trying to profit off mental health (which is not a good look for an app) also I feel like if something is to do with mental health it shouldn’t be locked in case someone is in need of it.

Subject: Going great!
Body: I’ve only just started this app and I’m already feeling understood! I know that there’s not really someone there listening to me, but it feels so nice to have a place to write my emotions down without being told my current emotional mindset is ridiculous. I don’t want to be told that I shouldn’t feel the way I do, I want to be heard and find a way I can help myself. So journaling really helps me understand myself better, and digitally makes me feel more comfortable. Overall I really recommend this app to keep contact with your mind in your own way :D

So great app, I understand the team need to make money but I am unable to pay for premium which isn’t great. Author: HeneRJ1000
Subject: Scam
Body:
First, they charged me $30 for a premium subscription when I first opened the app. (Quick background, I'm a 32 year old engineer and understand how to use an iPhone, but still somehow accidentally paid for a year long subscription.) After two days of not being able to use the app, I was finally able to create an account and log my first journal entry. 

As soon as I finished, I was offered a "special deal" for a now $60 premium subscription marked down from some even more absurd amount. After turning that scam offer down, I was finally able to use the app from the main menu. Only to find out that I had apparently only paid for a basic membership, which I was under the impression was free. That's when I noticed the "just for you" button with a heart at the top of the screen.

Well, just for me, was another offer for a premium membership.... This time a little cheaper at only $18 for an annual membership. Clearly this raised some concerns so I found the settings/menu of the app - which confirmed that I only had a basic membership, contrary to my credit card statement that clearly shows a $29.99 charge. I immediately went to my subscriptions through my apple ID to see what that said and, of course, it showed that I have a premium account. Go figure. Now, not only did I have a premium account, I had a $60/year premium account. That was the final red flag for me. 

I'll be filling a complaint with the app store and immediately notifying my credit card company of this fraudulent charge. 

I came here for help. I'm extremely disappointed. I strongly suggest not submitting your mental health to this.

Burde finnes en gratis versjon, eller så kunne det ha fortsettet som de første dagene. Ikke plutselig si at jeg må betale uten at jeg har trykket på trial!
Translated Body: At first I thought you did not have to pay but now I can only do a few things without paying! Morning motivation and daily reflection on the home page suddenly cost money this morning! It was free yesterday! I understand that they need money, but I do not bother to pay. Should there be a free version, or it could have continued as the first few days. Do not suddenly say that I have to pay without having pressed the trial!

Body: I found it really great app last year. I used it daily and found it really helped me release stress and take off anything on my mind. Even if I forgot to use it now and then I knew it was always there for me. But when it became 2021 the “New year new me!” Premium came it became more less usable, sorry I don’t know how to say it. It just felt more like a luxury now then an actual helpful tool that was there when ever I needed it. I still use it but it’s gotten boring.

Subject: Promotion
Body: Now the app itself is great, I love it. However I keep getting an “exclusive offer” for the premium version, and I can’t click out of it whenever this offer pops up, which means I can’t even use the app. Hopefully once the “exclusive” part goes away after 70 hours, I can go back to using the app as normal, and I can give It 5 stars. For now though, I’m just annoyed I can’t click the “no thank you” because it’s so close to “redeem offer” + I don’t think it even works.

Subject: This is really a journal to help you out
Body: I’ve been struggling with my family a lot lately. I’ve tried to write down in a journal I found a while back and it but this app really questions what I feel and the way I see myself. I can express my relationship problems, family problems and even my deep personal feelings regarding my family turning against me for my dreams and achievements. Some really bad that I’ve been clinically diagnosed with depression. It almost feels like a real friendly therapist I can Be with all the time and it really helps me release the struggles of studies, work and life

Author: NickTehFunGuy
Subject: Amazing
Body:
I was a little skeptical at first, but honestly, this app has made me so much more aware of my own emotions and feelings, and I feel like it genuinely has helped me to become happier. 

Turning on notifications is a must, it’ll help you get in the habit of being good at checking in every day, and eventually you’ll love it so much that you’ll remember just because you want to check in. 

If you’re a skeptic like I was, I’m here to tell you this app is worth it.

Author: uwulina
Subject: wow.
Body:
you know i’m kinda disappointed. i downloaded the app , expecting it to be like what it said on the description ,

“be prepared for stress relief , reducing anxiety & depression in your life. your self-care and mental health should always be a priority.” 

well that obviously was a lie.

that is only IF you have the money to pay. 

i understand you need money to run the app or whatever , but for a mental health app ?? seriously ?? cmon now.

we want to journal for our health and for our well being , but we obviously can’t do that with you constantly asking if we want premium.

no i don’t want premium! i want an app where i can just write and not worry about paying for stuff.

this app had potential , a lot of potential actually. but still terribly failed.

Author: Pilaroza
Subject: it’s good for some things but could be much better
Body:
I’ve been using this app daily for about a month now. I like being able to choose my mood and activities from a list of icons. And being able to scroll down my entries.

What i don’t like is that you can’t modify old entries, there was a picture I forgot to include on  another day and it’s impossible to add it now. And the process of writing a new entry is also quite tedious if you just want to write a fast note, sometimes i’m in a rush and i just want to write something down without having to choose a mood and activity, so that’s quite frustrating, it should be a feature already. There are so many ways to make the user experience easier and more enjoyable and yet ... The changes I want appear to be quite easy, lots of other apps have those features. I find this app quite simplistic and not adaptable considering that it has a ‘premium subscription’ I hope they will make updates soon or else I will not be renewing.

Author: Sassy_Reader
Subject: Almost 5 stars
Body: I just wish they didn’t make it cost money. As I think that would be what sets it apart from other apps. They all cost money but not everyone can buy it. So having an app a hundred percent free could really help people out there. As of right now it’s pretty good, but definitely could be better. It could suggest things to do when we’re down, or techniques to help us calm down. Or how to help us be more aware and knowledgeable of our feelings. It’s not bad though! I like it and it’s helped. But there’s always room for growth. Which I hope they eventually make the app better! It has a lot of potential and hasn’t reached it quite yet.

Author: Music&Art YAY
Subject: Okay
Body:
It’s a pretty nice app. Not really any ads,
Perfect. I’m pretty sure you can do way more with premium, but since I don’t have that I’m gonna talk about the cons of this app. 
1. It basically only has 4
Options. A mood check in, voice note, and the ads a picture. I did a mood check in, thinking it would tell me something new everyday. For example if I write in the description. “I cried.” I thought maybe it would say something like “crying is healthy.” “Your strong.” But once you do the mood check in, it doesn’t really do anything. What’s the point of it?! 
2. Every time I get on the app, it keeps asking about premium.

Author: Beetle.Z
Subject: Forces you to pay for the premium
Body: At first I was super excited to use this app because if it’s interface, but this one cheap move erases all of that excitement. I used this app literally once before the massive pop-up appeared telling me about this premium discount. It takes up the whole screen and the button “no thanks” is so low to the end of the screen, you can’t even press it. But the button “redeem my offer” if of course so close to “no thanks” that you press that instead. Also it does not disappear if you fully close out of the app.

Author: A Dot on beat BIGGEST FAN!!!
Subject: Excellent! Brilliant app!
Body: When I saw bad reviews for this app I wasn’t too sure, but I was pleasantly surprised to find out that was just people that are fussy. When I bought this app I thought it was marvellous! But when I got premium trust me, it’s even better, and very cheap! Even without premium you can do lots. And you don’t even have to write a diary every day! To be honest there isn’t a single glitch in that game. My heart really rose when I found out you get a HD picture on each diary entry! This is a truly excellent, brilliant app. I’m so glad, it asks you helpful questions and gives you a good deed to to for the day. Not to mention I love the adorable icon. Please give this a go you won’t regret it! 😁

Author: TOPPY12345678910
Subject: Love it but....
Body:
What I think what you guys should do is not lock up most of the quotes. Some of those quotes had helped with my whole life and most of the quotes are locked up and only for premium. I understand that you want to get the money and earn it but at least lock the ones that are reasonable to lock. Such as, social anxiety, letting go, and handling with stress. At least those three should be unlocked. Because I have lots of stress because of school so I want something to cheer me up with. 🥰🥰

I understand if you won’t be able to do these things because of money and I understand that. And it’s completely okay if you can not do these things.

Thank you for taking your time and reading this. 🥰🥰

Author: Elí Yokút G
Subject: Some other features?
Body: This app is good and all, but it needs some modifications. 1. You could make a feature where the quote background is customizable+more picture options. 2. More quote themes as in funny quotes, memes, etc. 3. A password protect feature. Yes you can buy apps for it, but having it built in to the app would be so much easier. I think that's all I have, but I've seen people complain about the subscription when its $40 a year. Do people not notice its rounded to 1 cent a day? So I overall rate this 3 star.

Subject: A must have life changer!

Then I began to use it and- WOW!!! After a mood entry, a daily reflection and my morning motivation (all accessible on the app) I just felt a lot better. And it tracks your moods and saves your entries, so you can look back on how you felt, what was worrying or making you happy etc. Highly recommend!!!!!!!

Body: It’s only my first day on this app and I can already see that writing my feelings into this app is going to help me a lot. It’s like my own diary. I am used to keeping my feelings inside. I never really share them or speak up, but with this app I can see that I will get closer to speaking my feelings. My only real problem with this app is the premium part of it. It always pops up on my screen, I wish there was a way to make it not pop up all the time.

Author: gehsjsiidjn
Subject: Good app but uses Fake quotes
Body: “Good things happen to those who hustle” is not an Anaïs Nin quote! The word hustle wasn’t even in her vocabulary at the time she was alive. I understand these quotes are just circulated over and over again but we need to be more responsible because it just isn’t right to put words in the mouths of the dead that they never said. It distorts their legacy and who they were. This quote is actually the opposite of everything Anaïs Nin wrote about. She wrote about sensuality, enjoying life’s pleasures, and going deep. She was a bohemian and “hustling” was not what they were about.

Subject: Four Stars for one reason...
Body:
Okay hi there. Starting off this review, I'd love to give this app five stars, but everytime I open it, it shows me an offer which I have declined multiple times. I don't want to buy anything and I get that its how you advertise. But I don't want to redeem my offer! Overall this is a great app so it's not much of a complication. Could you maybe fix that so I don't have to scroll and hit no thanks everytime I open the app? 

                   Thanks
                          Kaelynn

Author: Lexi_72
Subject: Premium, really?
Body: I understand the need for profit, but should an app being marketed as a self help journal to record your feelings and develop yourself require money to get access to basic information on how the user is doing? Doesn’t make complete sense to me. Despite the paying aspect, the limited capabilities of the app the non spender is privy to is structured very well and functions as a useful and aesthetically pleasing online journal.

Author: Eva.K.S
Subject: Helps ALOT!!
Body: Reflectly is amazing! It really helps me learn inner-peace and I think it’s making me a better person honestly. It allows me to look back at my check-ins and I can learn from my mistakes! For example, I see how rude I can be, or I can be insensitive to other people I know. There are also great quotes that you can read, and there are different categories. I went through a breakup recently, and the quotes really “lifted” me up though it. This app is a big changer!

Author: JadeZDragon
Subject: Reflectly Doesn’t Work Properly
Body: I don’t know why this app didn’t work in the past and it’s making me pay again. I already have a subscription so I just started a new one to get an account again. I just cancelled my new subscription just to use my old one (that I already paid for). Also it says I have to pay x amount and then charges me more than offered (not that it matters since I cancelled the new subscription). Just annoying to have to make a new account and set it up even though I already had an account, already had an email setup and already had a subscription. Anyways I’m gonna use this until my old subscription runs out... I’m not paying again for a new one unless I find that it is worth it. So for now I’m leaving this at 2 stars.
Topics: ["Design & UX", "Dissatisfied users", "Notifications & Alerts", "Payment", "Pricing", "Security & Accounts", "Sign Up & Login"]

Author: mabyebigbrain
Subject: Warming
Body: I love Reflectly, i downloaded it a while ago and I’m just now trying to incorporate it into my life more. I never noticed how good it makes me feel about myself until I spent time writing a solid paragraph. Real confidence booster! Reflectly also calms my nerves down. It makes me check in with my feelings and let me know if I need to talk to someone. And if I have no one to talk to, I can just keep on typing paragraphs into Reflectly! And of course, the main part Reflectly has been impacting my life is that it’s been improving my writing skills and vocabulary. This app makes me spill out my feelings more clearly and deeply. 10/10 recommend for anyone struggling with writing, coping with feelings, or just needs something to talk to that isn’t an actual person lol

Wenn man den Reminder für Affirmationen nutzt und eben diese Affirmation im Sperrbildschirm öffnet, gelangt man bei verlassen des Reminders direkt auf dem Homebildschirm, sprich, die Displaysperre wird umgangen. Author: Verdammt-nochmal (Mochi)
Subject: It seemed great
Body: Don’t get me wrong, this app is good to jot down feelings, grabs some good quotes, or just vent your feelings out to, but I find myself getting annoyed with it advertising their yearly subscriptions. I’m sorry but if it’s a mental fitness app and you’re trying to do good for others, I understand you have to make money but it can make people feel very unwelcome and forced. It’s not even a weekly thing, it’s ever single time you open the app or click a button you used once. Why am I not allowed to write the prompt after a certain time? Isn’t this supposed to help people? What about those who don’t have enough money and THAT’S why they’re stressed and need the app. A lot needs adjusted and other than checking in there’s very little to do on the app once you’ve used all of 2 prompts they give you with the basic plan.

Author: MiguelGtC
Subject: Estafa o error fortuito para los desarrolladores
Body:
Es buena app, pero roza la estafa. Afirman que es gratis pero cuando te va a dar el resultado, tras días recabando información, te obliga a pagar por el premium. 
Cuando intenté activar la versión de prueba de 7 días, sin cargos previos, me cogieron de la cuenta casi 60€, por suerte conseguí una devolución de apple. Después me ofrecieron la cuenta premium por 16,49€ anuales, al aceptar me querían cobrar 66,99€. No sé si es un error o está hecho apropósito pero apple debería de tomar cartas en el asunto.

Author: da_unknown
Subject: Really good journal app
Body:
I just got the app and right off the bat it seem pretty good. I don’t have a written diary or anything so when I’m on the road this is great for when I want to jot something down really quick. One reason I didn’t rate a full 5 ⭐️ was because of how many quotes your limited to.. I like the quotes but there are a ton of them when u subscribe. It just my opinion but I think that if you added a couple more like maybe 2 or 3 small categories for the quotes, that would really make it a great app. Other than that it’s been a great app for writing down my feelings 👍 

-edit I saw the price when I went to the app and I miss judged. Most subscriptions or in app purchases are either money grabbers or scams. This one is actually really good and it’s a nice low price too. Once I get enough I wouldn’t mind going for the premium version. I’m changing my rating to a 5 star rating ⭐️👍

Author: Jackson at the Beach
Subject: Fantastic
Body: Overall, I am very happy with my decision to download this app. It is very helpful and beneficial for people who want to check-in frequently about their mood and to reflect (possibly in the future). I have recently downloaded the app, and I come back every 3-4 hours to check-in, as well as read a few motivational quotes. I think the app is great without the subscription, and even better with it. I have one complaint and only one: too frequent notifications. I can always turn off the notifications, but the I tend not to notice apps and use apps as often. I get a notification every 1-2 hours, and it can sometimes be distracting or annoying at times. I highly recommend this app, and I hope you enjoy it as much as I do!

Subject: Reflectly

You also have daily customisable reminders and notifications, and you can choose what time to start sending them, and when to stop. You can also choose how much you want a day. You can add reminders to keep track of your day, and express how you feel to your own little companion! And yet I have just started exploring this world

Author: TrentU
Subject: Decent but annoying
Body: Reflectly is a journal that gives you insights into what days you’re happy and what made you happy. Not only can you do that yourself, but its locked behind a $60 paywall. Sometimes they offer “Just for you!” discounts but they don't actually drop the price at all. The quotes are a nice feature, not really a downside to them besides needing to pay to choose the type, but thats not a necessary thing. The app has a really sleek design that I love, but its annoying that you get a popup asking you to pay every time you open the app. If the team reads this, PLEASE stop with the advertising in your OWN APP. I understand that you have this service but it repulses me that it feels like one of those free mobile games where all the ads are for your own service. Finally, the actual journal checkins themselves. They are nice and helpful to get your thoughts and feelings out in an easier way than just seeing a blank page.

Author: I_ haveanxietyUxU
Subject: Helps me with my problems
Body: I do really like this app because it helps me with my problems at school and home. Sure, I have only been using it for one day but it really helps me a lot. I also like how it’s so cute like the little face that it shows helps me feel a little better and it will give you inspirational quotes and will try and help cheer you up. I first seen this on instagram and said “Maybe it won’t be so bad and will help” and I think it did. I may be young like younger than 14 but I do have lots of problems at school and home, and telling someone or something my problems makes me feel a little better. I personally think that talking through technology or paper is easier than talking in real life face to face with another, some stuff that also helps me is Minecraft, anime, gacha, and drawing. I recommend that you get this if you want something to talk to about your problems and you don’t feel comfortable with talking to real people like me.

Author: xX010010hoshi010010Xx
Subject: Why I downloaded Reflecty
Body:
I'm pretty young. That's the truth. But the thing is, I've been dealing with some things with my life (health problems, LGBTQ+ problems, etc.) 
I felt like I needed to start looking back at every day.
I was just scrolling through Tik Tok (The community might be bad, but there's no need to hate on dancing girls who express themselves.) when I saw an ad about Reflecty. Like I usually do, I was about to scroll off when I decided, "Okay. Fine--At least it isn't a shampoo ad." 
I watched it. That's all I did. But then I downloaded it. No harm in getting an app, really. I was right. I figured out that this was something I needed.
Thanks.-

Author: Egle Federica
Subject: Una truffa!!!
Body: Ho provato la versione gratuita per qualche giorno e, dopo essermi trovata bene, ho deciso di approfittare dell’offerta propostami e di abbonarmi alla versione completa per un anno. Risultato? Non appena finalizzato il pagamento tramite App Store, Reflectly mi ha “buttato fuori” dal mio account e ogni volta che tentato di riaccedervi - provandole proprio ma proprio tutte! - venivo liquidata con “Could not sign in for un unknown reason. Try again later”. Ovviamente la situazione non si è mai sbloccata... Assistenza impossibile da trovare e da contattare perfino passando tramite l’App Store!!! Ciliegina sulla torta? Ho infine ripetuto la procedura di creazione account inserendo e-mail e nome utente identici a quelli dell’account già attivato, confidando di essere riconosciuta come “account già esistente” e di esservi reindirizzata. E invece?!?!?! È stato creato senza batter ciglio un nuovo account identico a quello sul quale ho attivato l’abbonamento, che continuo a non poter sfruttare, né associare al nuovo account!!!!!! Una truffa fatta e finita!!!
Translated Body: I tried the free version for a few days and, after I was happy with it, I decided to take advantage of the offer proposed to me and subscribe to the full version for a year. Result? As soon as the payment via the App Store was finalized, Reflectly "kicked me out" of my account and every time I tried to log back in - trying them all! - I was liquidated with “Could not sign in for an unknown reason. Try again later ". Obviously, the situation has never been unlocked ... Assistance impossible to find and contact even via the App Store !!! The icing on the cake? Finally, I repeated the account creation procedure by entering e-mail and username identical to those of the account already activated, trusting to be recognized as an "existing account" and to be redirected to it. And instead?!?!?! Without batting an eye, a new account was created identical to the one on which I activated the subscription, which I still cannot use or associate with the new account !!!!!! A scam over and over !!!

Author: Iphoneonsurkea
Subject: ’’whats making you feel good/bad’’
Body:
Sometimes i feel good from one thing but something is bringing me yet down.  This happend often!

Could we please have a follow up, for example, say i feel good, i fill in the things makin me feel that way. Following this could be, ’are there any other things that are making you not feel good’? 

This would allow for much more cohere experience.

Lately i have done two check ins in one due to this problem and i believe it just messes up the overall avarage mood data and even may mess up some data about things that make us feel good or worse.

Please!

Author: _..Tania.._
Subject: Best app ever!!!
Body: This app is just the best! It helped me through so much when I couldn’t speak to anybody. I love it and if you are like me, and you wanna become more open to yourself, than you should definitely try it out, at least 5 days to see your stats! The unpaid version is just perfect so  you don’t need to be afraid of the fact that it is horrible if you don’t pay. Good luck and don’t forget to love yourself!

Subject: Amazing app, would recommend to anyone

Author: FireCool1441
Subject: The only journal I want to keep
Body:
I always wanted to start with journaling, and I did but it never stuck. Reflectly makes it so easy and also engaging and fun. I am much more aware of my daily moods, what makes me happy and why I feel bad. I love logging in my mood multiple times a day and make little notes about it. It’s also really cool how the app provides you with a stimulating new reflective question every day! 

This is the coolest, most important app I’ve found so far.

Translated Body: With the new mandatory premium version you have to pay to journal ..., it hurts to lose all my precious reflection moments, because unfortunately I don't have any money left for a journal app. I think the basic feature should be free.

Subject: Great app but...
Body: This app is awesome! I love it but on the second day of owning the app I tried opening a few things and it said in order to continue journaling you have to purchase premium... It brought me to a page to buy premium. Over all it’s a great app and I still use it for daily check ins etc. I do wish more of the app was available to use without having premium but otherwise it’s a great app :)

Author: AmooNah 93
Subject: Highly recommended
Body:
The app is absolutely wonderful in terms of aesthetics and intelligent content. I love the emotional symbol tags and the mood tracking features. Very well done.
My only no would be on the image entry that cannot be adjusted to the desired date, but rather be posted under the same day. This needs fixing. Another great feature to add is the voice notes where I record my voice speaking rather than writing. I believe our voices reflect our emotional condition in the way speak and the tone we use. Please consider this feature as well.
God bless.

Author: salesmarketking
Subject: Helps build accountability
Body: Love the quotes probably my favorite part of the app. That does not mean the self journal isn’t meant to be utilized. I’ve got about 7 logs so far and you’re able to see a pattern within yourself and it actually works to use it and do a gap report on yourself to figure out what that void is and why does it keep you going all over the place. A good tool to use with helping figure out what is going on with your days and weeks. I’ve narrowed down several character defects because of this app and I love it, one of the best I have and the simplicity of it makes it that much better.

Subject: Minimal options and paywall
Body:
I thought it would be a lot more than what it is and it’s clear what is most important for these developers. The dashboard of the page has a rate the app section and an anxiety help section which after initial cost of the app is still another $20. 

The quotes are good but apart from the mood check ins and reminders that’s about all you’re going to get from the app. Other options are to be payed for, and that’s besides the initial yearly fee, which to be fair is a good price. 

Morning motivation section is choices and has only one option for all categories, pretty weak in my opinion. Seems a little lazy and uninspired considering all that could be offered for motivation. 

The app is having a positive affect but leaves a lot to be desired.

Author: MizzMagicKid
Subject: It’s ok
Body:
I have a few problems with this app
1. It’s kinda boring to use. I mean, I know it’s supposed to be a journal app, but maybe you should add some fun stuff.

2. The premium. Most games have an optional payment, but most apps don’t. This is one of them. I know you “nEeD tO mAkE mOnEy” but not everyone has the money to afford it. It gives you one free day. ONE. Then the next day, you have to pay the premium. That just makes less people want to use this. Why do you even HAVE a premium in the first place? ITS A JOURNAL APP. The journal apps I’ve had didn’t have premium.
Over all, this app is okay. I don’t recommend it to people who aren’t willing to pay for a premium.

Author: lunarsimulation
Subject: Great app, but could use some UI tweaks
Body:
I have to track my emotions daily for my therapist, and this app has been really helpful. The clean, aesthetic design and the little clicks when you finish a note really help to incentivize mood-tracking. 

The only thing I would want to change is some of the user interface. Specifically, setting up new activities/emotions is awkward; instead of having to archive them if you want to make any changes, I feel like you should be able to edit the ones you’ve added in your settings so you can change the name or icon. I also think it would be nice to have the option to change the icons for pre-existing activities/feelings, or even archive the ones that aren’t relevant to your life. FINALLY! I think you should be able to choose multiple categories for the quotes you can get, but that might just be in the paid version, I’m not sure. Because of all this, I’m rating it a four out of five stars. This is a beautifully built, satisfying app, so these little issues end up standing out. 

I also have some suggestions. The lack of these features isn’t detrimental, but I think they could go a long way in improving the app. First, it would be great to have a simple goal tracker. I’ve seen these in other journaling apps and I can’t help but want them on your app. It wouldn’t have to be much, just a simple list of goals, maybe you could go in and press a button to say if you’ve succeeded. A second suggestion — you should be able to write quotes to yourself! I find the pre-existing quotes don’t really work for me, and I would love to write myself messages that I know I will need to hear in the future. 

I will also say that I think the price of the full version is a little much for what this app is, but since the free version isn’t too restrictive and doesn’t have ads, it’s not something I’ll complain too much about or take away stars over.

Author: an crooks slal
Subject: the best journaling app - ever.
Body:
in all my years of having apple products i’ve never once written a review for an app. but this app... this... app... is the best journaling app i’ve ever downloaded. i’d been trying to get into consistently journaling for a few years now but nothing never really stuck, until i found this. i will admit, if you just have the free version it’s not worth it. paying ~$1.25 a month for this is a game changer. i write it in probably 3 times a day or whenever I’m feeling something/need to get words off my chest.
you can track your mood, what’s making you feel that way, and emotion you’re feeling. 
it gives you daily motivational quotes whenever you need them, however many times a day you’d like. 
the user interface is BEAUTIFUL and incredibly easy to navigate. i will recommend this app to any and everybody i know. 
if you’re struggling with your mental health right now and looking for a way to help improve it, this is your sign. this app is for you. try it. it’s amazing.

Author: magicalunicorn14🦄
Subject: This app is great!!
Body: I really like this app not only because you can really tell “it” anything anytime you want. You can have multiple check-ins a day if you want too, if you skip any days there’s no notifications to tell you to come back and it’s completely your choice what you want to put down. Reflectively sends you emails about every day/every other day just asking about if you’re feeling ok or not, which is also completely optional. You can pay for Reflectively if you want to, but you don’t have too!! The app is just still really great and I don’t even pay for premium! You can change the settings anytime you want, and you can write notes on each day just saying how it was if you don’t feel comfortable telling someone through text and/or in real life. I think this app is/would be totally great for mentally unstable people, and it’s very calming. 10/10
